'coup'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-shares-oan-messages-calling-protests-a-coup-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4b81cb7ffa48002894d0bc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Portland protester\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A man who identified himself only as Jonathan wears a Guy Fawkes mask during a rally in support of President Trump on August 29, 2020 in Clackamas, Oregon.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nathan Howard/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>President Donald Trump shared a message from far-right news network One America News (OAN ) Saturday, branding ongoing anti-racism protests an attempted coup.&#160;</li><li>Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden has accused Trump of rooting for violence at ongoing demonstrations, which have resulted in deadly clashes between rival protesters in recent days.&#160;</li><li>Republicans though, have accused Democrats of ignoring violent unrest at protests.</li><li>On Saturday, a man was shot and killed in Portland, Oregon, after clashes between pro-Trump and Black Lives Matter demonstrators.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>President Donald Trump shared a message Saturday from far-right news network One America News branding ongoing anti-racism protests a \"coup\" aimed at unseating him.&#160;</p><p>For weeks, the president has been seeking to portray protests that swept America following the killing of George Floyd as the work of extremists and agitators.</p><p>The Trump campaign has seized on images of violence and looting at some protests to promote the president as a champion of law and order, with the theme at the center of last week's GOP convention.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4b83307ffa48002894d0c0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Trump, OANN\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Trump shared a message on August 29 from conservative news station OANN, branding ongoing anti-racism protests a &#34;coup.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Twitter</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On Saturday, Trump doubled down on the argument, sharing a message by OAN featuring a program on the network seeking to expose the protests as part of an anarchist coup.</p><p>\"According to the mainstream media, the riots &#38; extreme violence are completely unorganized. However, it appears this coup attempt is led by a well funded network of anarchists trying to take down the President,\" reads the message shared by the president.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.adl.org/resources/reports/adl-debunk-disinformation-and-the-blm-protests\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The ADL has previously labeled a</a>ttempts to portray the protests as mainly the work of extremists as disinformation. It pointed to the role of far-right media in spreading the claim.&#160;It pointed to the role of far-right media in spreading the claim.&#160;</p><p>The tweet comes amid growing concern about violence between pro-Trump and Black Lives Matter demonstrators at protests, and concerns the president's incendiary rhetoric helps instigate the unrest.</p><p>Democratic presidential nominee <a href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2020/08/27/politics/joe-biden-donald-trump-violence-cnntv/index.html\">Joe Biden told CNN last week </a>that he believes Trump is hoping for violence at the demonstrations, because it enables him to detract from his failed response to the coronavirus.&#160;</p><p>A <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kenosha-kyle-rittenhouse-charged-with-first-degree-homicide-2020-8\">17-year old Trump supporter is accused</a> of shooting dead two BLM demonstrators in Kenosha, Wisconsin on Wednesday. In Portland, Oregon, on Saturday, one man was shot dead following clashes between rival demonstrators. <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/30/us/portland-trump-rally-shooting.html\">According to initial reports,</a> the man killed was wearing a hat emblazoned with insignia of the far-right Patriot Prayer group.&#160;</p><p>Compared to its rivals, OAN has a tiny audience, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/one-america-news-donald-trump-news-network-2019-10\">but President Trump has repeatedly promoted conspiracy </a>theories and disinformation broadcast by the network to his supporters.&#160;</p><p>The network has repeatedly aired groundless and bizarre pro-Trump conspiracy theories, including the claim in May that <a href=\"https://www.newsbreak.com/news/1531375805941/after-suggesting-novel-coronavirus-was-created-in-north-carolina-oan-correspondent-says-that-same-conspiracy-theory-is-odd\">the coronavirus was invented in a US lab as part of a plot by infectious diseases expert Anthony Fauci, who has clashed with Trump over measures to contain the virus.&#160;</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the y_insider/~4/wnwGk3G-7h8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn36@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-00-57-006_bba5b4b13697abee.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650334},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Joe Biden condemned Portland violence as unacceptable 'on the left or the right' and challenged President Trump to 'do the same'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/joe-biden-portland-protests-condemns-violence-trump-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4c0a5d60bf1f0028079676?format=jpeg\" alt=\"joe biden\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden delivers remarks after meeting with Pennsylvania families who have benefited from the Affordable Care Act on June 25, 2020 in Lancaster, Pennsylvania.\n<p class=\"copyright\">JIM WATSON/AFP via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Democratic nominee Joe Biden challenged President Donald Trump in a lengthy statement on the violence that broke out Saturday night at a Portland, Oregon where Trump supporters and Black Lives Matter protesters clashed.</li><li>Biden flatly condemned the violence at the protest as \"unacceptable ... whether on the left or the right,\" and called for Trump to \"do the same.\"</li><li>\"He may believe tweeting about law and order makes him strong &#8212; but his failure to call on his supporters to stop seeking conflict shows just how weak he is,\" Biden said.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Democratic nominee Joe Biden issued a statement on the violence that broke out in Portland, Oregon, Saturday night that culminated in a man being shot and killed after supporters of President Donald Trump clashed with Black Lives Matter demonstrators in the city's downtown.</p><p>In the lengthy statement, Biden flatly condemned the violence at the protest as \"unacceptable ... whether on the left or the right.\"</p><p>\"I challenge Donald Trump to do the same,\" the statement reads. \"It does not matter if you find the political views of your opponents abhorrent, any loss of life is a tragedy.\"</p><p>Biden continued on to warn against becoming a \"country at war with ourselves\" that \"accepts the killing of fellow Americans who do not agree with you.\"</p><p>\"But that is the America that President Trump wants us to be, the America he believes we are,\" the statement says.</p><p>Biden pointed to Trump's divisive rhetoric, which most recently included a flood of tweets on Sunday taking aim at Portland, particularly Democratic Mayor Ted Wheeler, and demanding that the National Guard deploy to the city in response to protesters.</p><p>\"What does President Trump think will happen when he continues to insist on fanning the flames of hate and division in our society and using the politics of fear to whip up his supporters? He is recklessly encouraging violence,\" Biden wrote.</p><p>\"He may believe tweeting about law and order makes him strong &#8211; but his failure to call on his supporters to stop seeking conflict shows just how weak he is,\" the statement says.</p><p>The statement then said the \"job of a president is to lower the temperature. To bring people who disagree with one another together. To make life better for all Americans, not just those who agree with us, support us, or vote for us.\"</p><p>Biden's deputy campaign manager Kate Bedingfield echoed the statement's pressure on Trump in an appearance on <a href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/transcript/lara-trump-on-strategy-for-final-stretch-of-campaign-kate-bedingfield-on-civil-unrests-impact-on-race-for-white-house\">\"Fox News Sunday,\"</a> where she accused the president of \"inciting violence\" by encouraging aggression among his supporters in the protests of recent months.</p><p>White House chief of staff Mark Meadows defended Trump's response in an appearance on NBC's \"Meet the Press,\" where host Chuck Todd pressed the aide on the president's refusal to condemn violence among his supporters.</p><p>\"The president's on the side of law enforcement and the rule of law,\" <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-law-enforcement-and-the-rule-of-law-2020-8\">Meadows said</a>.</p><p>\"These are people that every single night conduct violent acts,\" Meadows said of demonstrators. \"And it is in Democrat cities. You know, you want to talk about Donald Trump's America. Most of Donald Trump's America is peaceful.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a To recap:</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-people-that-benefit-most-when-palantir-goes-public-2020-8\"><strong>Palantir</strong></a><strong>, <a data-uri=\"ec1a86024f09dac34815e730c4474398\">booting Fortnite from its App Store</a>, but Apple must continue to give <strong>Epic Games</strong> access to software developer tools and thus <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-digs-in-on-app-store-battle-with-fortnite-creator-2020-8\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"b12cfbf8d6fae81cda361eec81a13e59\">cannot try to choke Epic's broader game engine business</a>.<br ><section></section></li><li><strong>Salesforce</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/salesforce-layoffs-workers-severance-earnings-2020-8\">laid off off about 1,000 workers</a> a day after <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/salesforce-stock-price-q2-earnings-beats-analyst-estimates-raised-guidance-2020-8-1029536941\">reporting blockbuster results that surpassed Wall Street estimates</a>.</li><li>The <strong>SEC</strong> said it would for the first time allow people who are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sec-just-made-lot-easier-to-invest-in-venture-capital-2020-8\">not already rich to invest in startups and venture funds.</a></li><li>The 25-year-old CEO of <strong>Luminar</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/25-year-old-sells-startup-founded-high-school-34-billion-2020-8\">sold the self-driving-car startup he founded in high school in a $3.4 billion deal</a></li><li>The head of <strong>Uber Eats</strong> for the US and Canada <a pandemic.</a></li><li><strong>Google</strong> quietly <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/google-kirkland-office-urban-seattle-sundar-pichai-2020-8\">bought an office-development site near Seattle for $40 million</a>, suggesting that the pandemic isn't slowing its expansion plans.</li></ul><p>The biggest story of all, however, has been <strong>TikTok</strong>. <a Here's who is, who isn't, and why they might want it.</a></strong></li></ul><p>You can get more on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tiktok-amazon-walmart-bytedance-trump-riches-data-2020-8\">why Walmart wants in on a deal here</a>. And here's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/experts-on-oracle-buying-tiktok-reasons-motivation-2020-8\">what experts are saying about Oracle's interest</a>.</p><p>Related:</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/sai\">You can get all the latest on TikTok and tech right here.</a></li><li><a href=\"http://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/10-things-in-tech&hash=8122c716833601fc1471f79af063b104b104\">Sign up here to get the 10 things in tech you need to know in your inbox every weekday morning.&#160;</a></li></ul><hr ><h2><strong>The most powerful man in HR</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5eeb70a0aee6a851db058313?format=jpeg\" alt=\"johnny taylor at white house\" height=\"1365\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Taylor addresses Trump at the American Workforce Policy Advisory Board meeting on Wednesday, March 6, 2019\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/whitehouse/40344752773/in/photolist-24t8ppK\" target=\"_blank\">The White House/Flickr</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>From Shana Lebowitz:</p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>On February 1, 2018, employees of the Society for Human Resource Management convened for an all-staff meeting at a hotel near headquarters in Alexandria, Virginia.</em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>Some staffers were flown in from other parts of the country. The new CEO, Johnny C. Taylor Jr., treated employees to lunch and handed out SHRM-branded T-shirts.</em></p><p style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>Later that afternoon, former staff recalled, about two dozen employees were called individually into meetings with their division chiefs. It was their last day at SHRM, they learned. SHRM staff escorted them off the premises, where IT representatives wiped company email accounts off their phones. They got into their cars and drove home. Some were still wearing their celebratory SHRM T-shirts.</em></p><p>Taylor has turned the organization, which counts 300,000 HR professionals as members, around financially, Shana reported. But many former employees that Business Insider spoke with used the word \"fear\" to describe its culture. They also said they felt pressured to return to the office during the coronavirus pandemic. You can read the full story here:</p><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-shrm-ceo-johnny-taylor-transformed-the-largest-hr-organization-2020-8\">The CEO of the world's largest HR organization led a $20 million turnaround. Meet Johnny C. Taylor Jr., a visionary who insiders say embraces layoffs and dismisses COVID-19 fears.</a></strong></li></ul><hr ><h2>Investing philosophy</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e0f50a6855cc24f246e06a5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Savita Subramanian\" height=\"375\" width=\"884\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Bank of America equity and quantitative strategist Savita Subramanian\n<p class=\"copyright\">CNBC</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p dir=\"ltr\">If you're a close follower of market news, you've probably seen&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/savita-subramanian\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"e743efea19fd6ab24d1afe950b8cfe6f\">Savita Subramanian</a> on your television screen at one point or another, writes William Edwards. From his story:</p><p dir=\"ltr\" style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>The head of equity and quantitative strategy at Bank of America is a regular contributor to financial TV for good reason: She does some of the most influential work on Wall Street for one of the biggest investment banks. People care about what she has to say.</em></p><p dir=\"ltr\" style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>But odds are Subramanian isn't like many of the other analysts you might see making media appearances &#8212; or even generally similar to most people working in the numbers-heavy field of finance, for that matter.&#160;</em></p><p dir=\"ltr\" style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>Of course, Subramanian is well-versed in the quantitative side of things &#8212; she has a mathematics degree from the University of California, Berkeley, and an MBA with a focus in finance from Columbia University.&#160;</em></p><p dir=\"ltr\" style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>While at Berkeley, from which she graduated in 1995, she also majored in philosophy. The decision still informs her work, sometimes more than her other fields of study.</em></p><p dir=\"ltr\" style=\"padding-left: 40px;\"><em>\"My math major is what got me in the door, but my philosophy major is what kept me here,\" she recently told Business Insider in an exclusive interview.&#160;</em></p><p dir=\"ltr\">You can read William's full interview with Savita here:</p><ul><li dir=\"ltr\"><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-investing-strategy-wall-street-career-advice-savita-subramanian-2020-8\">Savita Subramanian uses her philosophy major more than her math degree as Bank of America's US equity chief. She told us how it guides her investing strategy &#8212; and shared the drivers behind her career success.</a></strong></li></ul><p>Here are some headlines from the past week you might have missed.&#160;</p><p>&#8212; Matt</p><section><hr ><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-leaders-companies-should-respond-jacob-blake-shooting-kenosha-wisconsin-2020-8\">We're analyzing company statements on the shooting of Jacob Blake. It could get really ugly if Trump loses the election.</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kellogg-mba-professor-high-performing-employees-possess-4-traits-2020-8\">I'm a professor at Kellogg who studies high-performing employees. Here are 4 signs you're one of them, and how to work with others who aren't.</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/meet-key-blackrock-leaders-driving-private-equity-alternative-investments-push-2020-8\">Meet the 17 power players at BlackRock carrying out CEO Larry Fink's vision to turbocharge private equity and alternative investments growth</a></p><p><a and are due for a surge</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/finix-pitch-deck-amex-ventures-lightspeed-series-b-2020-8\">Here's the 20-slide pitch deck Finix used to sell its vision of payments-as-a-service and nab $30 million from backers including Amex's VC arm</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/blackstone-prepares-post-labor-day-return-to-office-in-us-2020-8\">Blackstone is encouraging US workers to return to the office after Labor Day, and that's putting some employees on edge</a></p></section><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"White House chief of staff Mark Meadows says Trump is 'on the side of law enforcement and the rule of law'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-law-enforcement-and-the-rule-of-law-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4bf98660bf1f0028079665?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mark Meadows\" height=\"951\" width=\"1902\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows during an appearance on NBC&#39;s &#34;Meet the Press.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Meet The Press/NBC</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>White House chief of staff Mark Meadows on Sunday said amid tense protests, President Donald Trump is \"on the side of law enforcement and the rule of law.\"</li><li>Meadows made the comments on NBC's \"Meet the Press\" when moderator Chuck Todd asked him why Trump hadn't disavowed the actions of his own supporters, but frequently critiques the actions of other demonstrators.</li><li>Months of protests against racism and police brutality have seen violent and destructive actors, with clashes between anti-racism activists and supporters of the president.</li><li>Earlier Sunday, Trump, who has attacked Democratic leaders in cities where anti-racism protests have sometimes turned violent, tweeted \"LAW &#38; ORDER!!!\"</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>White House chief of staff Mark Meadows on Sunday said that President Donald Trump is \"on the side of law enforcement and the rule of law\" when Chuck Todd, the moderator of <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/meet-the-press/meet-press-august-30-2020-n1238812\">NBC's \"Meet the Press,\"</a> asked him why Trump hadn't publicly criticized the actions of his own supporters.</p><p>While months of protests against racism and police brutality &#8212; sparked by the May police killing of 46-year-old George Floyd in Minneapolis &#8212; have often been peaceful, like <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/photos-show-march-on-washington-rally-for-racial-justice-2020-8\">a march on Washington, DC, last week</a>, they've also at times been violent and destructive.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/one-shot-dead-in-portland-trump-supporters-blm-protesters-clash-2020-8\">One person was killed late Saturday in Portland, Oregon,</a> a city that's functioned as a microcosm of the nationwide political debate over the demonstrations as local and state leaders repeatedly clash with Trump over how to respond to them.</p><p>Although Trump has frequently critiqued the actions of Black Lives Matter activists and other left-leaning groups, there have also been reports of violent incidents around demonstrations involving right-wing groups and individuals. At a protest in Kenosha, Wisconsin, last week, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/rittenhouse-killed-protester-after-they-threw-plastic-bag-prosecutors-2020-8\">local police say 17-year-old Kyle Rittenhouse, a supporter of Trump, shot three people, killing two. </a></p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Meet the Press  (@MeetThePress) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300109915231604737?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>As <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-rails-against-protesters-following-unrest-portland-n1238808\">NBC News</a> reported, despite reports that their presence has in some cases led to further unrest, the president on Sunday tweeted praises of his supporters, calling them \"GREAT PATRIOTS!,\" while calling other protesters \"Disgraceful Anarchists.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Donald J. Trump  (@realDonaldTrump) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300019490177069060?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>\"I'm just trying to understand,\" Todd said, referring to Rittenhouse. \"The president denounced the violence on one side of protesters he didn't like, but why not denounce what this young man did?\"</p><p>\"Let me tell you where the president is,\" Meadows responded. \"The president's on the side of law enforcement and the rule of law. And he's been very consistent in that.\"</p><p>Earlier in the interview, Meadows further implied that violence in cities like Portland was the result of poor leadership by local and state Democratic leaders.</p><p>\"These are people that every single night conduct violent acts,\" Meadows said of demonstrators. \"And it is in Democrat cities. You know, you want to talk about Donald Trump's America. Most of Donald Trump's America is peaceful. It is a Democrat-led city in Portland that we're talking about this morning who just yesterday denied help once again from the federal government.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Donald J. Trump  (@realDonaldTrump) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300041598449917953?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>On Friday, Portland's Democratic Mayor Ted Wheeler <a href=\"https://www.portland.gov/wheeler/news/2020/8/28/mayor-wheelers-open-letter-president-trump\">wrote an open letter to Trump,</a> rejecting his offer to send federal agents <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/federal-agents-to-leave-portland-oregon-governor-kate-brown-2020-7\">back to the city</a> to help quash unrest.</p><p>\"When you sent the Feds to Portland last month, you made the situation far worse,\" Wheeler wrote, telling the president he did not want federal agents in the city. \"Your offer to repeat that disaster is a cynical attempt to stoke fear and distract us from the real work of our city.\"</p><p>\"We need to make sure that we hold people accountable,\" Meadows said on Sunday of violent actors. \"And ultimately, we need to make sure that these people that are conducting these acts go to jail.\"</p><p><strong>Read more: <br ></strong></p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/la-teacher-i-cant-breathe-shirt-2020-8\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">An LA teacher said she and her daughter had to flee their home after she received threats for wearing a Black Lives Matter t-shirt to class</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/trump-rips-into-portland-mayor-calling-him-fool-amid-protests-2020-8\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Trump rips into Portland mayor, calling him a 'FOOL' and urging the deployment of the National Guard to curb the protests</a></p><p><a 'genuine equality' on the anniversary of the 'I Have a Dream' speech</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/jacob-blake-police-shot-from-back-legal-2020-8\" data-analytics-position=\"4\" 20:00:02 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4bf9817ffa48002894d104?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"8d77f1dee0048e6f45fb3fb9ff26e6ed","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn75@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-52-358_7f933f173dc46e1c.webp","destWidth":1560,"destHeight":1168,"sourceBytes":64586,"destBytes":64586,"author":"insider@insider.com (Connor Perrett)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4bf98660bf1f0028079665?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn97@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-764_fb88ad5675664de7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=7PQYtze5hHI:Xd9LGIP5lGw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn50@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-01-00-600_7c6839d293331476.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=7PQYtze5hHI:Xd9LGIP5lGw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn9@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-01-00-353_197ef8e3d1df57c2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/7PQYtze5hHI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn98@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-192_476230579c970b80.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650322},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"My family of four saved thousands by doing a home exchange in the French Alps instead of a traditional summer rental. Here's what it was like.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/family-home-exchange-summer-vacation-rental-summer-in-france-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47b688db1ed00029714345?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Some of us found the mountain trails easier than others!.JPG Chrissie McClatchie\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The author&#39;s family hiking the mountain trails  near our home exchange in the French Alps.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissie McClatchie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Chrissie McClatchie is a freelance journalist who lives in the south of France with her husband and two daughters.</li><li>Instead of spending thousands on a vacation rental this summer, McClatchie's family opted to do a home exchange, swapping their apartment on the French Riviera for a house with a garden in the French Alps.</li><li>They only spent about $150 on the home exchange membership fee and less than $200 on transportation costs, and were also able to bring their cat along.&#160;</li><li>There were some growing pains to the experience, but McClatchie says they enjoyed their stay overall, and are eager to do another home exchange soon.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>This summer, my family and I went on a house swap organized through an international home exchange portal, <a href=\"https://homelink.org/\">homelink.org</a>. It was the first house swap we'd ever done. We traded our home, a 667-square-foot sea view apartment with terrace in Villefranche-sur-Mer, on the French Riviera, for a house four times the size with a garden, in a village in the valley between Grenoble and Chamb&#233;ry, in the French Alps.&#160;</p><p>I know it looks like we scored the best deal. But the truth was that we've swapped a sea breeze for a place everyone has told me is the hottest part of France in summer &#8212; and there wasn't even a fan, let alone air conditioning, in the house.</p><p>The first night, we all struggled to sleep because of the heat. As I laid awake, I wondered if maybe our friends and family had been right: were we crazy to have handed over our home to a stranger for 18 days? \"Weren't we worried about them touching our belongings?\" people had asked before we left.</p><p>For us, the incentive was financial: As a family of four, we've saved at least &#8364;2,500 (around $3,000) on the price of a lengthy vacation rental this summer &#8212; and that's a conservative estimate.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47b452cd2fec00296a47e2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The author with her two daughters and husband. Chrissie McClatchie\" height=\"576\" width=\"768\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>McClatchie with her two daughters and husband.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissie McClatchie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>A friend had recommended Homelink to us. The process to sign up and create a profile was easy. After writing a description about our apartment and our neighborhood, I uploaded some photos and paid the&#160; &#8364;125 ($148) <a href=\"https://homelink.org/fr/join\">annual fee</a>. (For US members, the annual fee is $99).&#160;</p><h2><strong>It wasn't long before we started to receive exchange offers</strong></h2><p>\"We always love to go to Villefranche for a holiday, so let us know if you fancy a week or so in London,\" one member wrote. In total, we had offers from England, Wales, Ireland, Belgium, Austria, Denmark, Germany, the USA, and France.</p><p>In the end, we decided on the first inquiry we had received, from a retired teacher in the French Alps. It was the pictures of the trampoline, swing set and outdoor playhouse that sold us. \"The girls will love the space,\" my husband said. Plus, Grenoble was just five hours away and the 250-mile drive would cost only about &#8364;80 ($95) each way in fuel and tolls. The listing also welcomed animals, so we could bring our cat.</p><h2><strong>As our first exchange, it felt wise to stay close to home in case anything went wrong</strong></h2><p>We signed the agreement in late January before any major COVID-19 outbreak in Europe. With hindsight, we can now see how fortunate our decision to stay in France this summer was.</p><p>Our home is one of approximately 8,000 listed in 70 countries on the website, Homelink's UK director Caroline Connolly told me via email. \"Quite a few members have hidden their listing at the moment due to COVID-19 travel restrictions,\" Connolly said.</p><p>Connolly explained that swaps are often arranged six to nine months in advance. \"A lot of exchanges were canceled early on,\" she wrote.&#160;</p><p>We had our moments of doubt, too, particularly as the COVID infection rate <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/french-riviera-pandemic-party-problem-saint-tropez-marseille-2020-8\">crept up again in France</a> in the weeks leading up to our departure.&#160;</p><p>But, as the usual crowds of August tourists started to descend on our village, we realized we would actually feel safer there than at home.</p><h2><strong>We arrived at a three-story stone house, which the owner said dates from the Renaissance</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47b3f8cd2fec00296a47dd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Chrissie McClatchie swapped an apartment in the south of France for a big house with a garden in Grenoble\" height=\"2249\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>McClatchie&#39;s family swapped an apartment in the south of France for a big house with a garden in Grenoble.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissie McClatchie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>The property sits at the foot of the Chartreuse mountain range. It's full of character, but it's also big and quite creaky. This was our exchange partner's 40th exchange and it showed: I found a welcome hamper in the kitchen and there are notes and instructions stuck all around the house. In the living room, folders of tourist information were spread out across the sofa. I wondered how I would ever keep the house clean.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47b527db1ed00029714334?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Chrissie McClatchie Around the house notices such as these ones, about what use each pile of towels were for, were stuck to the walls.\" height=\"2274\" width=\"3024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Around the house notices such as these, about what use each pile of towels were for, were stuck to the walls.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissie McClatchie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>But she didn't tell us everything, especially that her road is being dug up this summer. Most mornings we were woken by the sound of diggers driving past the bedroom windows. During the day, we often found machinery parked in the driveway. The road was covered in loose stones that bounce off the undercarriage of our car every time we left the house.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47b57cdb1ed00029714339?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Every time we opened the gates, we were reminded of the roadworks Chrissie McClatchie\" height=\"2249\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Every time we opened the gates, we were reminded of the roadworks.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissie McClatchie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>I found it hard to relax. It didn't help that soon after we arrived her two goldfish died, despite following their care instructions to a tee.</p><p>My husband was right when he said: \"The problem is this place isn't ours, so I can't settle into it.\" I didn't want to be that family &#8212; you know, the one that breaks heirlooms (or kills pets).</p><p>Luckily, my daughters were oblivious to all this. Our exchange partner has three grandchildren and boxes of their toys were left out for our children to play with. I really appreciated this touch.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47b5c2db1ed0002971433e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"My daughters enjoyed playing with toys on the big stone staircase Chrissie McClatchie\" height=\"2249\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My daughters enjoyed playing with toys on the big stone staircase.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissie McClatchie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>It took me a week, but I finally settled into vacation mode</strong></h2><p>I closed off rooms that we didn't need to use, and bought a fan to keep us cool. My daughters stayed entertained by playing in the garden.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47b63ccd2fec00296a47f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"My daughters loved the playhouse in the garden Chrissie McClatchie\" height=\"2448\" width=\"3264\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>My daughters loved the playhouse in the garden.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissie McClatchie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>We visited the three mountain ranges that surround Grenoble and discovered lakes and waterfalls that were both shady and socially distanced. We hiked child-friendly trails and got a glimpse of a snow-capped Mont Blanc in the distance.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f47b732db1ed0002971434b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"We may not have had a beach, but we hiked up to waterfalls instead Chrissie McClatchie\" height=\"577\" width=\"768\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>We may not have had a beach, but we hiked up to waterfalls instead.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Chrissie McClatchie</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Because we didn't have to budget for accommodation, and our transport costs had been modest, we also had more money to spend on vacation treats, such as nice cuts of meat for the barbecue.</p><h2><strong>Suddenly, our departure loomed, and I found myself already browsing exchange listings for next summer</strong></h2><p>\"The first exchange is always the hardest &#8212; the next one will be a breeze!\" Connolly signed off in her email.&#160;</p><p>Am I ready to test her theory and do it again? Definitely.</p><p>We were able to vacation in a house and garden in the heart of the French Alps without paying anything more than the Homelink registration fee, and the fuel and tolls to get there and back. It doesn't get much better than that, really.</p><h2><strong>Interested in a home exchange? Here are five things to consider:</strong></h2><ul><li>In practice, most exchangers are homeowners. \"Renters can exchange on the proviso that their landlord (and any associated mortgage and/or insurance companies) are happy with the arrangements,\" Connolly said.</li><li>You can specify dates and/or set preferred destinations, or leave either option open. Some listings offer a 'non-simultaneous' exchange, which means you don't have to swap homes on the exact same dates.&#160;</li><li>Your house doesn't have to be in pristine condition. \"Have a spring clean and declutter &#8211; you don't need a show home, but it should be clean and comfortable,\" Connolly said.</li><li>If you are travelling as a family, consider searching for an exchange partner with children of a similar age. For us, arriving at a house already equipped for play was invaluable.</li><li>If you are flying to your exchange destination, look for a listing that offers a car in the swap as well, as that will save on car rental fees.</li></ul><p><em><a href=\"https://twitter.com/ChrissieNice\">Chrissie McClatchie</a>&#160;is a freelance journalist who writes about luxury, lifestyle, and travel with a particular focus on the world of superyachts and stories from the south of France.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 20/08/31/06-00-53-928_575c641d11a49735.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/0exKQiY60Dw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn58@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-55-701_152029012ff4f5b4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650326},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Target, Kohl's, and Nordstrom are rolling out holiday deals before Thanksgiving, killing the shopping season as we know it","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/holiday-deals-target-kohls-nordstrom-begin-before-thanksgiving-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49232fcd2fec00296a4c95?format=jpeg\" alt=\"black friday\" height=\"3648\" width=\"4864\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Retailers want to avoid this scene this upcoming holiday season.\n<p class=\"copyright\">TREVOR COLLENS/AFP/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>For many retailers, the holiday shopping season will begin well before Thanksgiving this year.&#160;</li><li>Retailers want to avoid crowds and large order volumes that could lead to delays.&#160;</li><li>Complicating matters, UPS, FedEx, and the US Postal Service have all announced surcharges on holiday shipping that will go into effect later this year.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>This year, shoppers might start to see holiday deals roll out alongside leftover Halloween candy.&#160;</p><p>A growing number of retailers have said that due to the coronavirus pandemic, they will shift the timing of their holiday promotions to avoid the usual rush in November and December.&#160;</p><p>Target <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/target-stores-to-close-on-thanksgiving-like-walmart-2020-7\">recently said</a> that it would close its stores on Thanksgiving and start rolling out its holiday deals in October.</p><p>During the company's earnings call on August 19, CEO Brian Cornell said Target would have to \"stay nimble\" to adjust to a \"very different holiday season.\"&#160;</p><p>\"We're going to put a big premium on ease and convenience, delivering great value, but will emphasize safety. And we'll also make sure that our guests knows that those top items and that great value is going to be available throughout the season,\" Cornell said, emphasizing that the store's same-day fulfillment options would give shoppers flexibility on the timing of their shopping.&#160;</p><p>Black Friday as a shopping holiday <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/black-friday-is-dead-because-of-discounting-2018-10\">has been declining in importance</a> over the last several years as spending continues to move online and discounts become more prevalent year-round.&#160;</p><p>Still, beginning holiday deals in October represents a big shift to a seasonal schedule that usually sees retailers double down on the period between Thanksgiving and Christmas. A number of retailers, including Walmart and Best Buy, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/retailers-closing-their-doors-on-thanksgiving-full-list-2020-7\">have joined Target in saying</a> they would keep stores closed on Thanksgiving.</p><p>Nordstrom said in its own earnings call on Tuesday that while it would likely stop short of decorating stores for Christmas before Thanksgiving, it would make gifts available earlier in the fall than usual.&#160;</p><p>\"I think it's pretty clear that there's an opportunity for us to sell gifts prior to Thanksgiving,\" Pete Nordstrom, president and chief brand officer at Nordstrom, said during the call.&#160;</p><p>The changes aren't just about physical stores, though. Shipping volumes&#160;<a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-retail-shipping/fearing-shipping-crunch-retailers-set-earliest-ever-holiday-sale-plans-idUSKBN25H158\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"d5def91ff01fbce141d67c890dd74f91\">have been unusually high</a> as consumers opt to shop online and largely stay home amid the ongoing pandemic.</p><p>Victoria's Secret and Bath &#38; Body Works parent L Brands similarly said in earnings that it would spread its holiday promotions over a longer period of time rather than concentrate them in the fourth quarter, when it typically sees the \"majority\" of its annual sales and profits due to gift-buying.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/holiday-shopping-could-bring-issues-for-retailers-execs-2020-8\">The company said</a> it would do so because of \"traffic constraints imposed by social distancing protocols in stores and capacity restraints in our direct channel distribution centers,\" adding that it had a \"very cautious outlook about our ability to manage our typical holiday volumes.\"&#160;</p><p>Complicating matters, UPS, FedEx, and the US Postal Service <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fedex-ups-post-office-add-surcharges-before-busy-holiday-season-2020-8\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"6684a451bade7b638831eb0809ad190d\">have all announced</a> surcharges on holiday shipping that will go into effect later this year. Spreading deals out over a larger period of time could help retailers better manage the impact of those surcharges.&#160;</p><p>In Kohl's earnings call, CFO Jill Timm referred to the surcharges as a \"headwind\" and said the company is working through alternatives to avoid them. Kohl's is also looking to get holiday shopping going in October.</p><p>The pandemic has disrupted the usual retail calendar in more ways than one. The back-to-school shopping season, for example, doesn't seem to have provided the sales surge that certain retailers usually see, as distance learning has continued for many students across the country.&#160;</p><p>Abercrombie &#38; Fitch CEO Fran Horowitz <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/27/abercrombie-fitch-anf-reports-q2-2020-surprise-profit.html\">told CNBC</a> that she expects both back-to-school and holiday shopping to stretch on for longer than usual. She called the trend a \"flattening of the curve.\"&#160;</p><p>\"Maybe the peak [around] Black Friday isn't as big, but there is still a lot of opportunity in December to do a lot of business,\" Horowitz told CNBC.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/holiday-deals-target-kohls-nordstrom-begin-before-thanksgiving-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/5o_D78Lvl-M\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 30 Aug 2020 16:15:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f492575cd2fec00296a4ca6?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"87ddbdad4c6a4f0aa41451c06dea8801","destWidth":4864,"destHeight":3648,"sourceBytes":787044,"destBytes":787044,"author":"mstone@businessinsider.com (Madeline Stone)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f49232fcd2fec00296a4c95?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn68@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-00-688_87ddd38f26508d34.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=5o_D78Lvl-M:gJ7aFaauyYU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn7@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-59-713_92ee6be5b338a90a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=5o_D78Lvl-M:gJ7aFaauyYU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn74@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-56-487_bd4998bdff4b23c4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/5o_D78Lvl-M":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn13@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-00-348_8f0f2baf78004046.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650324},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Rahm Emanuel says Trump's politics is 'his version of Hunger Games' where he pits 'American against American'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/rahm-emanuel-trumps-politics-pits-american-against-american-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4bf2367ffa48002894d0fc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"rahm emanuel\" height=\"512\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel speaks about Chicago&#39;s weekend of gun violence during a news conference at the Chicago Police Department 6th District station, Monday, August 6, 2018 in Chicago, Illinois.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/chicago-mayor-rahm-emanuel-speaks-about-chicagos-weekend-of-news-photo/1012183384?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Joshua Lott/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Former Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel on Sunday said President Donald Trump's \"version of American politics is his version of Hunger Games.\"</li><li>Emanuel said in a roundtable on ABC's \"This Week\" that Trump is \"literally pitting American against American\" when \"Americans are exhausted of this constant conflict.\"</li><li>Trump has been rejecting his advisers' concerns of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/george-floyd-trump-ignores-advice-to-curb-divisive-rhetoric-nyt-2020-5\">stoking divisive messages </a>to prompt <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-convinced-white-grievance-is-key-to-reelection-report-2020-7\">grievance from white voters,</a> according to previous reports from The New York Times and Washington Post.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Former Chicago Mayor Rham Emanuel slammed President Donald Trump's divisive rhetoric and leadership as a version of \"Hunger Games.\"</p><p>Emanuel <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ABCPolitics/status/1300094070304526336\">appeared on ABC's \"This Week\" on Sunday</a> shortly after the White House announced <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-visit-kenosha-jacob-blake-shooting-protests-family-2020-8\">Trump's plans to travel to Kenosha, Wisconsin</a> to meet with law enforcement and Jacob Blake's family one week after Blake, a 29-year-old Black man, was shot by police.</p><p>Speaking on the planned trip, Emanuel asked: \"Does anybody for a moment think that he's bringing calm &#8212; or chaos and conflict?\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;ABC News Politics  (@ABCPolitics) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300094070304526336?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>\"His version of American politics is his version of Hunger Games,\" Rahm added. \"He is literally pitting American against American.\"</p><p>He said that Trump's divisive politics is \"not the solution\" when \"Americans are exhausted of this constant conflict.\"</p><p>Emanuel's comments come after months of protests for <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/photos-show-march-on-washington-rally-for-racial-justice-2020-8\">racial equality</a> and justice emerged across the US in response to <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/black-man-george-floyd-dies-after-police-officer-kneels-neck-2020-5\">George Floyd's killing</a> in Minneapolis police custody.</p><p>Trump has often raised alarms with his dismissive and antagonistic responses to the protests, including a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-tweets-looting-shooting-george-floyd-protests-minnesota-2020-5\">tweet he posted in May</a> that said in part, \"When the looting starts, the shooting starts.\"</p><p>After <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-warning-trump-tweet-george-floyd-glorifying-violence-2020-5\">Twitter flagged</a> his tweet for \"glorifying violence,\" <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-defends-his-when-the-looting-starts-the-shooting-starts-tweet-2020-5\">Trump defended </a>that the tweet was \"spoken as a fact, not as a statement.\" In June, Trump shared then deleted a video of a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-video-supporter-white-power-good-people-2020-6\">white man chanting \"white power.</a>\"</p><p>Meanwhile, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/30/us/politics/trump-threatens-protesters-dogs-weapons.html\">The New York Times</a> reported last month that several aides have \"urged\" the president to \"modulate his rhetoric\" as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/george-floyd-trump-ignores-advice-to-curb-divisive-rhetoric-nyt-2020-5\">Trump continued to stoke unrest with divisive rhetoric</a> amid protests against police brutality.</p><p>But Trump has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/donald-trump-convinced-white-grievance-is-key-to-reelection-report-2020-7\">ignored these concerns</a> and remains convinced he must focus on the \"grievances of his core base of white voters\" to win the election, according to <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-racism-white-nationalism-republicans/2020/07/04/2b0aebe6-bbaf-11ea-80b9-40ece9a701dc_story.html\">the Washington Post.</a></p><div src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/ZS4RM9ZVHSM\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 30 Aug 2020 18:52:21 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4bf24e7ffa48002894d0fd?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"cf35dd191cb40339f2edb585de0d97b2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn27@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-52-311_c7a6c59b89164ad3.webp","destWidth":910,"destHeight":683,"sourceBytes":16762,"destBytes":16762,"author":"ichoi@businessinsider.com (Inyoung Choi)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4bf2367ffa48002894d0fc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn97@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-01-04-035_874680612179b7ce.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=ZS4RM9ZVHSM:oFQ6PcDZ9PQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn81@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-59-472_34c7032f12e4d79f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=ZS4RM9ZVHSM:oFQ6PcDZ9PQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn17@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-01-02-759_c5b9b3a84ebb9148.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/ZS4RM9ZVHSM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn53@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-702_c2f3b13b785a91c6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650323},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Even before the pandemic, American kids were eating more fast food than ever before, says new study","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/american-kids-were-eating-more-fast-food-before-the-pandemic-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4931f97ffa48002894cdbb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Fast food  burger\" height=\"1916\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Justin Sullivan/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Black and Hispanic children eat more fast food than white kids, and teenagers eat more fast food than younger children, a study by the CDC shows.</li><li>Fast-food consumption has risen during the pandemic, with hot dog sales increasing by more than 120% in March.</li><li>In the UK, there are fears that a government-funded eat-out scheme will lead to higher obesity rates.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>American children and adolescents are eating more fast food than ever before &#8212; but just how much varies greatly by age and ethnicity, a report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has revealed.</p><p>The report found that children and adolescents got an average of 13.8% of their daily calories from fast food between 2015 and 2018. The previous figure, from 2011 to 2012, was 12.4%.</p><p>The study also shows older children consume a higher proportion of calories from fast food. Children aged 2 to 11 get 11.5% of their daily calories from fast food, rising to 18% for those aged 12 to 19.</p><p>Black and Hispanic children eat more fast food than white kids, the report said.</p><p>More than a third of American children eat fast food on any given day, the report said.</p><p>The CDC report is based on data from the most recent <a href=\"https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/search/datapage.aspx?Component=Questionnaire&CycleBeginYear=20172017\">National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey</a> in 2018, meaning it doesn't take the effects of the pandemic into account. But by all indications, American diets have moved more toward convenient and affordable foods in recent months.&#160;</p><p>During lockdown, the sales of many fast food products have skyrocketed, with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hot-dog-sales-soar-as-best-quarantine-food-during-pandemic-2020-5\">hot dog sales increasing by more than 120%</a> in March year-on-year.&#160;</p><p>However, it isn't just comfort cravings that are causing Americans to eat more unhealthy food. People have less time and money to invest in cooking nutritious meals &#8212; during the pandemic, more jobs have been lost than at any time since the Great Depression.&#160;</p><p>Grocery prices, which rose by about <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/grocery-food-prices-skyrocketing-coronavirus-recession-unemployment-bonus-benefits-expire-2020-8\">3.6% from April to July,</a> may have also contributed to increased fast food consumption.&#160;&#160;</p><p>It isn't just the price that makes fast food attractive. Parents are juggling working and looking after their kids who are spending more time at home. The American Camp Association says 80% percent of overnight camps and 40% of day camps have remained shut this summer because of lockdown. These time-strapped Americans are turning to the convenience of takeout food, and many delivery services are soaring. Domino's reported that its US same-store sales <a href=\"https://fortune.com/2020/08/12/coronavirus-food-trends-takeout-delivery-pizza-dominos-covid/\">rose by 16% in the second quarter of 2020</a>, and in the first half of the year generated $240 million in net income - 30% higher than in 2019.</p><p>In the UK, there are similar concerns that obesity rates will rise because of the pandemic. To support the hospitality industry the government introduced the \"Eat Out to Help Out\" scheme in August, where diners at eligible restaurants, cafes and bars can receive 50% off the cost of their meal. This is subsidized by the government. The offer was used more than 64 million times within its first three weeks, and UK Chancellor Rishi Sunak said that this program is supporting nearly 2 million employees in the hospitality sector.</p><p>However, fast-food restaurants like McDonald's, Burger King, and KFC are eligible for the scheme. This has brought widespread concerns that it will accelerate UK obesity rates, with the National Obesity Forum arguing that it would be a ''green light to promote junk food.\"</p><p>This increased fast food consumption during lockdown, in turn, is making people more at risk from COVID-19. Obese individuals &#8212; those with a BMI over 30 &#8212; are 113% more likely to be hospitalized from the virus, and have a 48% higher risk of death, according to <a href=\"https://www.unc.edu/posts/2020/08/26/obesity-linked-with-higher-risk-for-covid-19-complications/\">a study</a> by the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.</p><p>Some countries are taking desperate steps to fight this rise in obesity. Recently Oaxaca became the first state in Mexico to ban the sale of junk food and sugary drinks to children. Businesses who break the new law can be fined and risk closure, and their owners can even face time in jail. This isn't the first radical measure introduced in the country to combat its childhood obesity rate, which is among the highest in the world. In 2014 a country-wide tax on sugary drinks and junk food was introduced. Despite this, 73% of Mexicans are currently classified as overweight, <a href=\"https://www.oecd.org/about/secretary-general/heavy-burden-of-obesity-mexico-january-2020.htm\">according to the OECD</a>. This figure was just 20% in 1996.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/american-kids-were-eating-more-fast-food-before-the-pandemic-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 14:15:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4932027ffa48002894cdbc?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e2b0f3b2dda45889aa50bfa1fdf99933","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-52-380_6219ecf858e79c0f.webp","destWidth":2554,"destHeight":1916,"sourceBytes":257032,"destBytes":257032,"author":"insider@insider.com (Grace Dean)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4931f97ffa48002894cdbb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn78@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-58-686_946a08f0172968f6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=wpOvYi0QQ0o:zEUR1VPhfc4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn57@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-01-02-262_aaf03685790851af.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=wpOvYi0QQ0o:zEUR1VPhfc4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn12@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-58-864_7f94bb25920a1493.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/wpOvYi0QQ0o":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-59-326_37a7c42b3f5b06bc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650326},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"I'm a 20-year-old entrepreneur who's launched companies that reach millions of users — here's why being young worked to my advantage","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/reasons-being-a-young-entrepreneur-can-be-an-advantage-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee2645d19182436866260a5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Black business owner entrepreneur\" height=\"2000\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Being a young entrepreneur has unexpected advantages.\n<p class=\"copyright\">DragonImages/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Adam Guild, a 20-year-old founder and CEO of restaurant ordering system Placepull, is a lifelong entrepreneur. He launched his first successful project when he was 13, and has since built companies that reached millions of users.&#160;</li><li>Guild believes being a young entrepreneur gives you unique strengths that can work to your advantage when attracting brands and business leaders.&#160;</li><li>There's more time to take risks and learn from your mistakes when you're young, so take this time to form a fresh perspectives that will differentiate you from older, more experienced entrepreneurs.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>I began my first successful entrepreneurial project when I was 13, and I'm here to tell you: Being young makes it much harder to start a&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/business\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/business\">business</a>. It's harder to build trust with customers. It's harder to raise money from investors. And it's harder to build authority with employees. When I started my restaurant-technology business, people at&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/trade-shows\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/trade-shows\">trade shows</a>&#160;would look me up and down, roll their eyes, and walk away &#8212; often saying something condescending about my age.&#160;</p><p>But&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/steve-jobs\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/steve-jobs\">Steve Jobs</a>,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/bill-gates\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/bill-gates\">Bill Gates</a>, and&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/larry-page\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/larry-page\">Larry Page</a> started their companies at ages 20, 21, and 24 respectively. <a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/apple\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/apple\">Apple</a>,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/microsoft\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/microsoft\">Microsoft</a>, and&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/google\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/google\">Google</a>&#160;are now collectively worth over $2.7 trillion. Each one of them leveraged their&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/youth\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/youth\">youth</a> to their advantage, and turned that weakness into a strength.&#160;</p><p>So did I.&#160;</p><p>In fact, I now believe that being a&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/young-entrepreneur\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/young-entrepreneur\">young entrepreneur</a>&#160;can be a secret weapon. Here's why:</p><h2>1. You aren't trapped by the existing ways of doing things</h2><p>Steve Jobs, founder of Apple, said, \"Don't be trapped by dogma &#8212; which is living with the results of other people's thinking.\"&#160;</p><p>When you're young, your perspective on the world is fresh. Whereas others have spent years learning how things are, everything is new to you. You have no choice but to think about things from scratch. You can think more clearly about what's required to solve problems today, without having the dated reasoning of yesterday, because you haven't been conditioned to believe things have to be the way they are.</p><p>For example, when I decided to help restaurants grow using digital marketing, most people would have done it the \"usual\" way: building an agency full of consultants and doing everything manually. This is how it had been done since digital marketing became a thing in 1998.</p><p>But I wasn't limited by that way of thinking. I never even considered doing it manually. I went straight to building technology to automate it and optimize it, and the result was exponentially greater outcomes for our customers and higher profits for our business.</p><h2>2. It's the best time to take risks</h2><p>It's hard to make something from nothing &#8212; to build a sustainable business &#8212; and it's really risky.&#160;</p><p>The best time to do it is when you're young. Larry Page, who was 24 when he founded the internet giant Google, once said, \"I&#160;encourage you to take a little more&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/risk\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/risk\">risk</a>&#160;in life. If you do it often enough, they will really pay off.\"</p><p>When you're a young entrepreneur, you don't have a family depending on you, or a mortgage to pay. You haven't gotten used to living a fancy life.&#160;</p><p>So you have the freedom to take big risks, which may not pay off.&#160;</p><p>It's the time in life when you generally have the least to lose. I'm now 20, and the companies I've built over the past seven years have collectively reached millions of users. My company was recently valued at over $13,000,000.&#160;</p><p>But I still drive a modest car, live on groceries, wear cheap clothing, don't vacation, live as a minimalist, and keep my expenses very low so that I can take bigger risks and compound my capital. The money my competitors are putting into big salaries and fancy lifestyles I invest in building a bigger business.</p><h2>3.&#160;\"People don't take you seriously at first. But when they do, they go overboard.\"</h2><p>That's a direct quote from Bill Gates, who founded tech giant Microsoft when he was 20 years old. He has since created over 144,000 jobs and created $1.06 trillion in market value.</p><p>Gates says that people were skeptical of him at first because of his age, but that when they realized he knew what he was talking about, they became extremely enthusiastic and tried to work with him as much as possible. His age became a part of the story that helped sell customers, because they enjoyed feeling like they were supporting a young prodigy and genius.&#160;</p><p>I've had that same experience. Billion-dollar brands who were skeptical at first became extremely enthusiastic and supportive once they saw that I knew what I was talking about. They liked helping a young person. Top business leaders like&#160;<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/sean-rad\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ai-metadata\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/sean-rad\">Sean Rad</a>&#160;(founder of Tinder) and Greg Creed (CEO of Yum Brands) might&#160;have ignored me if I was older, but they ended up sharing fantastic advice and becoming mentors.&#160;</p><p>My age became an advantage because it was a point of differentiation. It reminded them of when they were young and just getting started.</p><h2>4. You have more time to fail</h2><p>Success comes with a lot of failures. And failures suck. They can feel like wasted time. But they're also inevitable when pursuing success. As the world's richest man, Jeff Bezos, said, \"<a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/topic/failure\" data-ga-category=\"autotag-linking\" data-ga-label=\"ent-tags\" data-ga-action=\"/topic/failure\">failure</a>&#160;and invention are inseparable twins.\"</p><p>And it's best to fail fast when you're young. I've personally experienced some emotional punches in the face. My first project &#8212; a Facebook-like network for my sixth-grade class &#8212; was shut down by school authorities in a matter of weeks. My second one &#8212; a popular Minecraft server network &#8212; was threatened by Microsoft. Along the way, people that I thought I could count on let me down. I spent months on initiatives that utterly failed. I flew across the country for trade shows that didn't get me any customers. I embarrassed myself publicly again and again. Even though each failure was frustrating at the time, I was able to grab lessons from each experience and move on, with more time left to do better in the future. I'm glad I did.</p><p>So yes, being a young entrepreneur is especially challenging. It's harder to get others to believe in you, and it's harder for most young people to believe that they can be successful, since they often see themselves as just kids.&#160;</p><p>But our youth is also a secret weapon with powerful advantages if you learn to recognize them.&#160;</p><p>So don't stall your start and use your age as an excuse. None of the greats do.</p><p>Go. Get started. Now is the best time.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/reasons-being-a-young-entrepreneur-can-be-an-advantage-2020-8'>Business
