(Adam Guild)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5ee2645d19182436866260a5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn10@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-58-029_e9a644816ef6c0bd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=j-8omhLmGm8:sKf3IFhlANE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-59-204_2687798ce01f340d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=j-8omhLmGm8:sKf3IFhlANE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn63@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-01-521_0d9e7098db8c11d3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/j-8omhLmGm8":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn71@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-122_4eb2b7640cf51120.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650329},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Trump isn't the 'law and order' president. He's the 'lawless and disorder' president.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-is-not-law-order-president-lawless-disorder-rnc-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c1d39a0dde8674abe36973b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"donald trump\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump\n<p class=\"copyright\">Rick Loomis/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Throughout the Republican National Convention, speakers tried to paint President Trump as the \"law and order\" president.</li><li>But Trump has routinely shown a disregard for the law, sown chaos across the country, and promoted disorder in our society.</li><li>Michael Gordon is a longtime Democratic strategist, a former spokesman for the Justice Department, and the principal for the strategic-communications firm Group Gordon.</li><li>This is an opinion column. The thoughts expressed are those of the author.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Throughout the Republican National Convention, a variety of voices cast the incumbent as the \"<a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1276207454888448001\">law and order</a>\" president.&#160;</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/donald-trump-jr-promises-law-order-and-a-light-at-the-end-of-the-tunnel-024356695.html\">President Trump's offspring</a>, the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mark-and-patricia-mccloskey-rnc-speech-video-2020-8\">dog whistlers of St. Louis</a> and various elected officials like <a href=\"https://www.foxnews.com/politics/rnc-daniel-cameron-speech-trump-kentucky-attorney-general-shannon-bream\">Kentucky Attorney General Daniel Cameron</a>, Democrats are soft on crime. They even <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-says-democrats-are-party-crime-we-fact-checked-his-n920451#anchor-ClaimDemocratswanttoturnAmericaintoagiantsanctuaryforcriminalaliensandMS13thugsAnddontkidyourselfthatswhatsgoingtohappenTrumpsaidintheVirginiarally\">encourage crime</a> and are hell-bent on <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wHWZPYKcyl0\">abolishing the police</a>.&#160;</p><p>These speakers have assured people that Trump will keep law-abiding Americans safe, even if it means <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/06/02/can-trump-send-military-shut-down-protests-heres-what-you-need-know/\">deploying US troops</a> on our own soil.&#160;</p><p>But this narrative, like many spun by the Trump campaign, is more farce than fact, another attempt to draw focus from Trump's handling of the pandemic, economy, and racial injustice. Make no mistake, Trump is not the law and order President. He is the lawless and disorder President.</p><h2><strong>Lawless</strong></h2><p>Our \"law and order\" president has consistently shown a disregard for the \"law\" portion of that idea throughout his time in office.</p><p>He has <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/02/19/us/politics/trump-pardons.html\">abused the pardon power</a> to shrug his shoulders at corruption - perhaps because it's fundamental to his life's work. He has granted clemency to Jared Kushner pal <a href=\"https://www.sfchronicle.com/bayarea/article/Trump-pardons-former-Assemblyman-Pat-Nolan-who-13849385.php\">Patrick Nolan</a>, who pled guilty to racketeering; <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/05/15/us/politics/conrad-black-pardon.html?action=click&module=RelatedLinks&pgtype=Article=Article\">Conrad M. Black</a>, a friend convicted of fraud; and former governor. and Celebrity Apprentice contestant <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/trump-expected-grant-clemency-former-ill-gov-rod-blagojevich-ex-n881051\">Rod. Blagojevich</a>, who infamously tried to sell a US Senate seat.&#160;</p><p>Like the member of a good crime syndicate, Trump protects his buddies who protect him. He rewarded <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/article/trump-pardons-commutations.html\">Roger Stone</a>'s silent loyalty with commutation. His Justice Department dropped charges against Michael Flynn <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/05/08/852582068/mike-flynn-pleaded-guilty-why-is-the-justice-department-dropping-the-charges\"><em>after </em>Flynn pleaded guilty to the charges</a>. And with Steve Bannon's days of freedom <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/20/nyregion/steve-bannon-arrested-indicted.html\">in peril</a>, it feels as if the question isn't if Trump will pardon him but when.</p><p>Instead of standing up for truth in justice, Trump bristles at perjury charges - such as when Rudy Giuliani cried \"<a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/videos/politics/2018/08/08/trump-legal-team-responds-to-mueller-giuliani-bash-wolf-vpx.cnn\">perjury trap</a>\" to explain why the president would not be interviewed by Robert Mueller. Truth is truth, despite Giuliani's <a href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/sunday-talk-shows/402527-giuliani-truth-isnt-truth\">claim to the contrary</a>, and there's no need to claim \"perjury trap\" when the facts are on your side.</p><p>Trump has even built lawlessness into his public policy. <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/reps-22-foreign-governments-have-spent-money-trump-properties-n1015806\">Dozens of officials from other countries</a> have spent money at his properties, likely in violation of the Emoluments Clause of the Constitution. His foreign policy decisions reek of <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/global-opinions/trumps-corrupt-dealings-with-turkey-are-some-of-the-most-startling-stories-in-boltons-book/2020/06/23/0c24a5a2-b59a-11ea-a8da-693df3d7674a_story.html\">corruption and conflicts of interest</a>, and his immigration policies have likely <a href=\"https://time.com/5626498/trump-asylum-rule-international-law/\">violated domestic and international law</a>.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Crooked</strong></h2><p>Even before his presidency, Trump was involved in <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/elections/2016/06/01/donald-trump-lawsuits-legal-battles/84995854/\">more than 3,500 lawsuits</a>, including for his \"<a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/onpolitics/2018/04/10/trump-university-settlement-judge-finalized/502387002/\">sham university</a>\" that defrauded students and for underpaying his <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/27/nyregion/trump-tower-illegal-immigrant-workers-union-settlement.html\">undocumented employees</a>.</p><p>Then, there were his 2016 election crimes. The Republican-led US Senate Intelligence Committee did what Special Counsel Robert Mueller failed to do: prove decisively that Trump's campaign <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2020/08/24/senate-intelligence-committees-report-really-is-damning/\">colluded with Russia</a>. Meanwhile, there is strong evidence that Trump also <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2018/12/14/evidence-that-trump-broke-campaign-finance-laws/\">broke campaign finance laws</a> that same year by participating in <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/donald-trump-played-central-role-in-hush-payoffs-to-stormy-daniels-and-karen-mcdougal-1541786601\">hush-money payments to women</a>.</p><p>Ultimately, some of his crimes in office would be too <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2019/9/26/20885201/trump-ukraine-whistleblower-complaint-hearing\">clear and </a>obvious for Trump to slink away from entirely. He was of course impeached -- but not convicted -- of crimes that can be punishable by <a href=\"https://theintercept.com/2019/10/10/trump-crimes-law/\">several years in prison</a>.&#160;</p><p>Despite his stain on history, Trump seems ever <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2019/12/23/790687293/trump-appears-to-be-emboldened-by-house-impeachment-vote\">more emboldened</a> to cross legal and ethical lines.</p><h2><strong>Disordered</strong></h2><p>President Trump also fails on the second half of his \"law and order\" claim.,&#160;</p><p>His words and actions don't help maintain order but rather sow division, unrest, and chaos.&#160;</p><p>He speaks out against an \"<a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tQQDc7gU3YA\">angry mob</a>\" of peaceful protesters but <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WIs2L2nUL-0\">encourages mob violence</a> at his rallies. He calls himself an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-speech-dc-ally-to-protesters-police-tear-gas-photos-2020-6\">ally to peaceful protesters</a> but sends federal troops to tear gas<a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/01/us/politics/trump-st-johns-church-bible.html\"> them</a> so he can have a photo op. He <a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1216356280933273600\">calls on foreign leaders</a> not to kill their protesters but warns Americans that \"<a href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1266231100780744704\">when the looting starts, the shooting starts.</a>\"&#160;</p><p>It's never been about order. It's a faux strength masking a President's deep insecurities.&#160;</p><p>A president who <a href=\"https://www.newsweek.com/trump-claims-he-has-legal-right-meddle-doj-former-officials-say-it-would-grossly-improper-1487399\">openly meddles with the Justice Department</a> cannot be a shield for our nation. A president who <a href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/20/us/nationwide-protests-saturday/index.html\">calls peaceful demonstrators \"thugs\"</a> but sees \"<a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/politics/archive/2017/08/trump-defends-white-nationalist-protesters-some-very-fine-people-on-both-sides/537012/\">very fine people on both sides</a>\" in Charlottesville cannot restore \"order\" to a nation awakened to racial injustice.&#160;</p><p>If Donald Trump were truly a man of order, he would unequivocally condemn this week's <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/aug/26/jacob-blake-shooting-gun-battle-in-kenosha-on-third-night-of-unrest\">murder of protesters</a> allegedly at the hands of a young <a href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/news/513858-kenosha-shooting-suspect-attended-trump-rally-in-january-report\">supporter</a>. He would turn off the <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2020-election/overrun-angry-mobs-s-d-gov-noem-calls-out-democratic-n1238320\">heated rhetoric</a> that inspires <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/jun/27/us-far-right-violence-terrorist-threat-analysis\">far-right violence</a>. But by now we know he's not capable.</p><p>Trump claiming the mantle of law and order is like the US <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/2020/8/26/21402124/rnc-coronavirus-past-tense-larry-kudlow\">claiming victory over COVID-19</a>. It immediately fails the smell test.&#160;&#160;</p><p>There are many words to describe heads of state who freely bend, flout, and manipulate laws for personal and political ends. Think dictator or strongman, not president.&#160;</p><p>Trump's past and present prove that he is the last person capable of hoisting the law and order banner, and the last person we need in the White House for four more years. It's not what it is.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-is-not-law-order-president-lawless-disorder-rnc-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?a=d70mLreDPVw:TcZfcwvgE-M:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/d70mLreDPVw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 30 Aug 2020 13:06:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4a78a07ffa48002894d059?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"55ed9cc35f37fdc368a86ad3277398ea","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn63@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-52-298_2f7e35390f66901e.webp","destWidth":1778,"destHeight":1333,"sourceBytes":76866,"destBytes":76866,"author":"insider@insider.com (Michael Gordon)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5c1d39a0dde8674abe36973b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn45@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-01-00-480_4a2ff68d175196cb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=d70mLreDPVw:TcZfcwvgE-M:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-01-592_4cbb2d9122d1f915.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=d70mLreDPVw:TcZfcwvgE-M:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn50@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-02-311_ad2f8c24bb907e81.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/d70mLreDPVw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn76@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-01-476_98b5385e60800f58.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650330},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Pompeo's RNC speech was a scary preview of what 'America First' looks like after Trump","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/pompeos-rnc-speech-scary-preview-of-america-first-after-trump-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4975e77ffa48002894cfc3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mike Pompeo RNC speech\" height=\"1280\" width=\"2560\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Secretary of State Mike Pompeo addresses the 2020 Republican National Convention from Jerusalem, August 25, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Secretary of State Mike Pompeo's Republican National Convention speech this week was seen by critics as similar to the rest of Trump's foreign policy: brash, defiant, and not always reflective of reality.</li><li>That doesn't matter, because Pompeo doesn't care what critics think, and what he's offering is what you can expect from Trump's \"America First\" politics after Trump is gone, writes New America fellow and Arizona State University professor Candace Rondeaux.</li><li>This is an opinion column. The thoughts expressed are those of the author.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Is Mike Pompeo the Teflon Don reincarnated? If you watched the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=05alxh2Zjvw\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">US secretary of state's pre-recorded speech</a> to the Republican National Convention on Tuesday, you'll know your answer doesn't matter, because Pompeo doesn't really care about what you, many Americans or the world thinks.</p><p>Pompeo delivered his address from Jerusalem while on an official diplomatic trip to the Middle East, breaking decades of political norms, and likely federal ethics laws. In this new era of American gangster diplomacy, what matters is always being right &#8212; as Pompeo sees it &#8212; and always being unapologetic in strong-arming the world into accepting the Republican Party's isolationist and increasingly authoritarian bent under the GOP's godfather-in-chief, President Donald J. Trump.</p><p>Federal laws prohibit civil servants from using their office, title or government resources to influence election results. So Pompeo's remarks provided more proof that he genuinely believes that those laws don't apply to him, and that he's a made man as long as Trump's \"America First\" vision of the world prevails.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b92d6e00ce5f592208b4ecb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mike Pompeo\" height=\"2000\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Pompeo speaks at State Department headquarters, May 1, 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/license/953385806\" target=\"_blank\">Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The Democratic chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee, Eliot Engel, said this week that his committee would launch an investigation into whether Pompeo's RNC convention speech from the rooftop of the King David Hotel in Jerusalem violated the <a href=\"https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/5/7323\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hatch Act</a>, a federal statute that bars civil servants, including Cabinet secretaries, from mixing their official government duties with partisan politics.</p><p>But like New York City's one-time mafia kingmaker, <a href=\"https://www.fbi.gov/history/famous-cases/john-gotti\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">John Gotti</a>, who repeatedly escaped prosecution, Pompeo has played the role of an untouchable and loyal mafioso, enforcing Trump's new world disorder and repeatedly testing the limits of the rule of law since his appointment as America's top diplomat in 2018.</p><p>Pompeo and his close associates have twice been the subjects of investigations into misconduct at the State Department.</p><p>First, there was the <a href=\"https://foreignaffairs.house.gov/_cache/files/3/7/371f6cc5-e8ff-4107-9eb3-58d58e85f216/D61CA667E291A5DB4139B057A98A3ACD.hfac-dem-letter-to-ig-investigation-on-emergency-arms-to-saudi-arabia.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">State Department inspector general's congressionally mandated inquiry</a> into whether the department's Bureau of Political-Military Affairs overrode a vote by Congress last summer to block the sale of $8.1 billion in arms to Saudi Arabia. Then, there was the investigation into allegations that <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.nl/secretary-of-state-mike-pompeo-wife-susan-ethics-taxpayer-money-2020-7/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Pompeo and his wife routinely ordered his State Department staff</a> to run personal errands on his behalf, and used State Department resources to enhance his political profile.</p><p>So far, Pompeo has managed to escape accountability for these alleged abuses of power and government resources, in part by appearing to commit more of them.</p><p>First, he convinced Trump to fire the State Department's inspector general, Steve Linick, who was investigating him. Then, Linick's replacement, Acting Inspector General Stephen Akard, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/mattperez/2020/08/05/acting-state-department-inspector-general-resigns-after-less-than-three-months/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">abruptly resigned in early August</a>, though he was, in any case, <a href=\"https://www.academyofdiplomacy.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/DG-Letter-to-SFRC.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">apparently held in poor regard by many in the US diplomatic corps</a>.</p><p>The House Foreign Affairs Committee has since taken up an investigation into Linick's firing. But with the Republicans in firm control of the Senate in what is shaping up to be a precarious election year for endangered incumbents, not much is likely to come of the effort to hold Pompeo's feet to the fire this year.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5bc5f45bdff09410742ab2c8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mike Pompeo\" height=\"1333\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Pompeo with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Leah Millis/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>America's top diplomat has at the same time been a key frontline warrior in Trump's unwinnable trade war of attrition with China, while playing small ball on the much more winnable \"tech wars\" by imposing <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/05/pompeo-untrusted-chinese-apps-should-be-removed-from-us-stores.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bans on popular Chinese-owned social media apps TikTok and WeChat</a>.</p><p>In his convention speech, Pompeo also cheerily reminded the world that Trump's series of friendly summits with North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un helped \"lower the temperature\" with the regime in Pyongyang, while carefully eliding the fact that <a href=\"https://www.nti.org/analysis/articles/cns-north-korea-missile-test-database/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">North Korea has carried out 52 missile tests since Trump took office</a> in January 2017, according to the nonpartisan <a href=\"https://www.nti.org/analysis/articles/cns-north-korea-missile-test-database/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Nuclear Threat Initiative</a>.</p><p>There are 46 other countries on the Asian continent other than North Korea and China, including Turkey, Japan, India and Pakistan, which constitute by far America's most consequential, if at times inconsistent, partners in a wide region where geopolitical competition between the US and China is likely to be the most intense for generations to come.</p><p>As it is, tensions between China and India over the disputed Himalayan border territory of Ladakh only seem to be worsening, with India's defense chief, Gen. Bipin Rawat, <a href=\"https://thediplomat.com/2020/08/ladakh-standoff-indias-defense-chief-notes-military-option-on-the-table/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">saying that military options remain on the table</a>. Given Pakistan's close diplomatic relations with Beijing, and its dependence on China for military goods and trade, the high-stakes standoff between Chinese and Indian soldiers on the world's rooftop sets up the possibility for a three-way shooting war involving three nuclear-armed countries.</p><p>This is one time when it might make sense for America's secretary of state to signal that a focus on allies is as important as adversaries in US foreign policy. It was only six months ago, after all, that <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-south-asia-51638345\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Trump proudly touted his bromance with India's prime minister, Narendra Modi</a>, on his last major diplomatic trip before the coronavirus pandemic. Trump has similarly tried to muscle Japan's prime minister, Abe Shinzo, into being a key ally in an America First coalition of the coerced, arrayed against a rising China.</p><p>Yet there was not a single mention of Japan or India in Pompeo's convention speech.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a203bde3dbef4cc1d8b903d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mike Pompeo\" height=\"694\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Pompeo also enthusiastically touted the US assassination of Iran's top general, Qassem Soleimani, in January, ignoring the determination by UN human rights investigators that the <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-iran-un-rights/un-expert-deems-us-drone-strike-on-irans-soleimani-an-unlawful-killing-idUSKBN2472TW\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">American drone strike in Baghdad that killed him was unlawful</a>.</p><p>He praised the Trump administration's shredding of the Iran nuclear deal, even as it became clear that the UN Security Council would <a href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/08/unsc-dismisses-demand-impose-snapback-sanctions-iran-200825163456943.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">reject the Trump administration's demand to trigger \"snapback\" sanctions</a> against Iran that were part of the deal the White House trashed and withdrew from unilaterally.</p><p>Then there was the most embarrassing part of the speech, Pompeo's blithe commentary on the state of US-Russia relations, Ukraine and NATO.</p><p>\"Today, because of President Trump, NATO is stronger, Ukraine has defensive weapon systems, and America left a harmful treaty so our nation can now build missiles to deter Russian aggression,\" he declared.</p><p>While there are ultimately <a href=\"https://www.worldpoliticsreview.com/articles/28957/don-t-fear-a-u-s-troop-withdrawal-from-germany\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">sound reasons for the recent US decision</a> to redeploy thousands of American troops stationed in Germany to Poland, it is undeniable that the White House's move, and how it made it, has created more fissures within the already unsteady trans-Atlantic alliance.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a2038bc3dbef425008b92ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mike Pompeo\" height=\"1267\" width=\"1900\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yuri Gripas/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>It's all well and good that after more than a year of dithering, <a href=\"https://www.thedrive.com/the-war-zone/34638/ukraine-cleared-to-move-javelin-missiles-to-front-lines-to-blow-up-russian-tanks-defensively\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Ukraine now appears to be prepared to deploy its US-made Javelin anti-tank batteries</a> closer to the contested region of Donbass in eastern Ukraine. But there is zero indication that there is a Ukrainian-American game plan in the event that Russia escalates its operations in Ukraine, either in response to ongoing negotiations over the status of Donbass and Crimea, or to the <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/08/25/905808711/facing-the-biggest-challenge-ever-to-his-power-lukashenko-looks-to-russia-for-he\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">still bubbling situation in neighboring Belarus</a>.</p><p>On top of all that, why anyone would view the idea of ramping up another nuclear arms race with Russia after the US pullout from the Intermediate-range Nuclear Forces Treaty as a good thing is beyond me, and probably several million other Americans. There is so much that is illogical about the Trump administration's Russia policy, including the lack of response to repeated provocations between Russian and American forces in the field, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/26/world/middleeast/pentagon-russia-syria.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">most recently in Syria this week</a>.</p><p>Pompeo's RNC speech was, in a nutshell, just plain defiant and deceptive. But it was also pretty scary. If you were at all curious about what America might look like under Trump's most avaricious and aspiring political heir apparent, Pompeo's taxpayer-funded campaign speech and preening to the RNC is probably the closest thing to a crystal ball.</p><p>Trump or no Trump, the trajectory of the GOP's foreign policy is unlikely to veer far from this brand of ultranationalist diplomacy as long as Pompeo remains a leading light of the party.</p><p><em>Candace Rondeaux is a senior fellow and professor of practice at the Center on the Future of War, a joint initiative of New America and Arizona State University. Her <a href=\"https://www.worldpoliticsreview.com/authors/2516/candace-rondeaux\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">WPR column</a> appears every Friday.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the /31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/Dlos687-f9g":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn24@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-58-908_1a0a78637edf9ce8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650329},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"This Mercedes-Benz Sprinter camper van conversion that can sleep 6 skyrocketed in popularity amid the pandemic — see inside the $68,900 Doc Holiday","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/off-highway-vans-doc-holiday-family-friendly-camper-van-conversion-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f48169edb1ed00029714606?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Vans</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Off Highway Van created the Doc Holiday, a customizable Mercedes-Benz Sprinter camper van.</li><li>The van can accommodate up to six people, making it a good camper van for families with children, according to Off Highway Van's co-founder Seth Riddle.</li><li>The Doc Holiday has skyrocketed in popularity amid the pandemic as more families started opting for road trips instead of international travels.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Off Highway Van created the <a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\">Doc Holiday</a>, a customizable family-friendly <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/mercedes-benz\">Mercedes-Benz</a> Sprinter camper van that has seen skyrocketing interest from families since the start of the pandemic.&#160;</p><p>Doc Holiday can accommodate up to five to six people, which is done by having two separate sleeping spaces.</p><p>The first is a foldable, three-panel bed that is topped with a four-inch foam mattress. This accompanies the second sleeping space, which doubles as a seatbelt-equipped bench seat during the day. At night, this four-seater bench can unfold into a 68-inch by 73-inch bed at night.</p><p>According to Off Highway Van's co-owner Seth Riddle, this five to six-person capacity is one of Doc Holiday's biggest selling points, therefore securing its place as a family-friendly camper van and the second most popular build that the company offers.&#160;</p><p>Almost every customer who has purchased a Doc Holiday has been a parent or grandparent who wants to bring their children or grandchildren on road trips, contributing to the van's skyrocketing popularity amid the pandemic as more <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/camper-van-conversion-companies-resilience-in-sales-despite-the-coronavirus-2020-5\">families started canceling international trips and opting instead for road travel around the US</a>.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tWhen a listing of the Doc Holiday was posted by Off Highway Van amid the pandemic, the company started receiving three to four calls a day from interested customers, amounting to 75% of its inquiries.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481cfecd2fec00296a4ac2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The 144 inch Doc Holiday camper van\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 144-inch Doc Holiday van with upgrades.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\"The van sold in a heartbeat,\" Riddle told Business Insider. \"All these families are like, 'Oh, you know what? We've been planning to do this down the road, but we've got all this time now, [so] let's commit to it.'\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d05db1ed0002971462b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday van with optional add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBeyond the Doc Holiday, inquiries for builds by Off Highway Van has been so high, the company is now struggling to meet demands and has a six-month waiting list as a result.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d0ecd2fec00296a4ac3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\"[The uptick in demand] opened our eyes,\" Riddle said. \"There's this huge market for the family that has been ignored by the market for years, and upfitters are starting to come around to it.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d15db1ed0002971462c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The 144 inch Doc Holiday camper van\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 144-inch Doc Holiday van with upgrades.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThere is a wide variety of possible camper van bases, but the Utah-based company went with the ever-popular Mercedes-Benz Sprinter.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d1ecd2fec00296a4ac4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Vans</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAccording to Riddle, the Sprinter is in high demand because of its appearance, diesel engine, torque, and four-wheel-drive capabilities.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f48164acd2fec00296a4a94?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Vans</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe van can either come as a 144-inch or 170-inch, the latter providing a larger kitchen and living area.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d2edb1ed0002971462d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday van with optional add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tDespite this option for a longer interior, the 144-inch — which was built more for weekend vacations or short bi-annual trips — is the more popular choice.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d52db1ed0002971462e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The 144 inch Doc Holiday camper van\" height=\"1638\" width=\"2184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 144-inch Doc Holiday van with upgrades.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t\"A lot of people love the 144...because of its versatility,\" Riddle said. \"Some people are like, 'it's gotta be compact, fit it in a parking spot, and I want this to be the soccer mom car,' but then on the weekends, they're hitting the trails...and getting lost.\"\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d5bcd2fec00296a4ac5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1638\" width=\"2184\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a camper vanners interested in taking an extended trip.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d6bcd2fec00296a4ac6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a currently being used by a customer who once lived in New York, but decided to move to Wyoming amid the pandemic.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481d9acd2fec00296a4ac7?format=jpeg\" a \"satellite home base\" for trips in conjunction with a friends' home and personal property.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f48165bdb1ed00029714602?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc build, but can range up to $200,000 with different add-ons.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481da2cd2fec00296a4ac8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Highway Van's team using light aluminum and wood-less composite materials, creating a waterproof and strong structure, according to its makers.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481dc3cd2fec00296a4ac9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1250\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><em>Source: <a href=\"https://b6655063-035a-4486-8638-5f66bfed271c.filesusr.com/ugd/0f635e_062133957b9740c1b2ed95a3768a3f86.pdf\">Off Highway Vans</a></em></p>\n\tThe ceiling is lined with vinyl fabric, while the walls are tweed fabric.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481dcacd2fec00296a4aca?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday van with optional add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a fan and several windows, such as awning windows with screens by both sides of the bed.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481dd3cd2fec00296a4acb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Vans</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tWhen it's dark out, the interior can be brightened up with its eight LED lights.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481de0db1ed00029714634?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIts interior is powered in part by its 2,000-watt inverter charger, 200-watt solar panels, and a 224-amp hour battery system.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481decdb1ed00029714635?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Vans</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThese power systems also supply the energy needed for the van's USB, 12-volt, and 110-volt outlets.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481dfbdb1ed00029714636?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1648\" width=\"2198\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor family meals on the road, the kitchen has a 22-inch by 20-inch butcher block countertop, refrigerator, and freezer ...\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481e02db1ed00029714637?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Vans</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\t... and a sink that accompanies the 15-gallon fresh water tank and five-gallon grey water tank.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481e0fdb1ed00029714639?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1656\" width=\"2208\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe main bed platform sits 37 inches above the floor, making room for accessories, such as mountain bikes, in the cargo area.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481e2cdb1ed0002971463a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1613\" width=\"2150\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Van</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe cargo garage space also has an L-track mounted onto the floor to help keep gear in place.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481e18cd2fec00296a4ace?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1648\" width=\"2198\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday with add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Vans</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tOther amenities, such as an exterior shower, air conditioner, and roof rack, come at additional costs.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f481e33db1ed0002971463b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"144 inch Doc Holiday camper van Mercedes Benz Sprinter\" height=\"1668\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>An 144-inch Doc Holiday van with optional add-ons.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.offhighwayvan.com/VanModels/Doc-Holiday-Mercedes-Sprinter\" target=\"_blank\">Off Highway Vans</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the //cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn19@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-59-846_3bc80745835eca09.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=Oza1XMFqd2Q:Wkqj_WGp27w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn90@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-01-02-615_7819c612547007fa.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/Oza1XMFqd2Q":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn12@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-01-02-687_2ced150733a56cb5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650334},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Teslas were 3 of the 10 fastest-selling used cars amid the coronavirus pandemic, according to the data — see the full list","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/10-fastest-selling-used-cars-pandemic-according-to-data-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f495a0360bf1f00280794bc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2018 Subaru BRZ\" height=\"857\" width=\"1142\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 2018 Subaru BRZ.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://media.subaru.com/image-gallery.do?method=adhoc&#38;imageIds=5104&#38;mid=1&#38;searchresult\" target=\"_blank\">Subaru</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Car search engine and automotive research firm iSeeCars.com compiled a list of the 10 fastest selling used cars during the pandemic.</li><li>There are three Teslas in the compilation, including the Model 3, which tops the list with its average sell time in 29.3 days.</li><li>Besides the three Teslas, a BMW, Subaru, Infiniti, and two Toyotas and Hondas are included as well.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Car search engine and automotive research firm<a href=\"https://www.iseecars.com/cars-for-sale#section=studies&study=fastest-selling-cars&v=2020p;v=2020\"> iSeeCars.com has compiled a list</a> of the 10 fastest-selling used cars amid the pandemic.</p><p>On average, used cars sold in 68.9 days during the pandemic. However, the 10 cars iSeeCars identified for its study have all sold 1.3 times faster than this over a two-month time frame.</p><p>This includes the Tesla Model 3, which tops the list with its average of 29.3 days on the used car market before being sold.</p><p>The slowest-selling vehicle on the top-10 list also happens to be another <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/tesla\">Tesla</a>: the Model S, which averages at around 59.7 days. The third Tesla included in iSeeCars' list is the Model X, sitting in sixth place with an average of 47.6 days on the market.</p><p>Other than these three electric vehicles, iSeeCars' list is occupied by a BMW, a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/subaru\">Subaru</a>, an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/infiniti\">Infiniti</a>, and two <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/toyota\">Toyotas</a> and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/honda\">Hondas</a>.</p><p>iSeeCars analyzed over 4.8 million car sales for the study, which includes new and used vehicles. For the used segment, iSeeCars pulled data from vehicles in the 2015 to 2019 model year that were sold between March to June 2020. However, heavy-duty and low volume cars&#160; &#8212; as well as vehicles taken off the production line before the 2020 model year &#8212; were excluded from the study.</p><p>Keep scrolling to see which cars made the cut:</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t10. Tesla Model S — 50.7 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49561a7ffa48002894cf04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2015 Tesla Model S P85D _0\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 2015 Tesla Model S P85D.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of RM Sotheby&#39;s</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>According to iSeeCars, the Model S' price &#8212; which averages $53,776 used &#8212; started dropping when the Model 3 arrived on the market.&#160;</p><p>Used Teslas dominant this list because the vehicles still remain popular in the used car market due to the automaker's over-the-air software updates, according to the study.</p>\n\t9. Toyota Corolla Hatchback — 50.2 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4936ac60bf1f0028079375?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2019 Toyota Corolla hatchback\" height=\"2121\" width=\"2828\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 2019 Toyota Corolla Hatchback.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://pressroom.toyota.com/vehicle/2019-toyota-corolla-hatchback/\" target=\"_blank\">Toyota</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The hatchback iteration of the Corolla arrived on the market last year, accounting for its low inventory in the used segment. Despite this low inventory, the vehicle has an average used price of $18,602, making it the third less expensive car on the list.</p>\n\t8. Honda Accord — 50 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4956f27ffa48002894cf19?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2019 Honda Accord\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 2019 Honda Accord.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://hondanews.com/en-US/releases/release-1780c4ba26684cc2a83cb4e2f3eeca9b-honda-accord-and-odyssey-earn-2019-edmunds-best-retained-value-awards?modal=photo-f2aea8f90b134f10ac654f4a0edb5914\" target=\"_blank\">Honda</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The Accord, and its previous Honda companion on this list, are both popular cars in the US.</p><p>The Accord has an average used price of $18,702, just $100 more than the Corolla.</p>\n\t7. INFINITI Q60 — 49.4 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49578360bf1f00280794a1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2018 INFINITI Q60.\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 2018 Infiniti Q60.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://usa.infinitinews.com/en-US/channels/channel-300?query=INFINITI&#43;Q60&#43;2018&#38;selectedTabId=channel-300-photos&#38;modal=photo-34b1de86217d4bed9dd8d03e35ce1b8f\" target=\"_blank\">Infiniti</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"The sporty two-door coupe is known for its powerful engine, and is likely popular for buyers who want to enter the luxury sports car segment,\" iSeeCars CEO Phong Ly said in a statement.</p><p>The Q60 has an average used price tag of $30,726.</p>\n\t6. Tesla Model X — 47.6 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49584660bf1f00280794a8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"A Tesla Model X at a Santa Monica, California showroom on Aug. 8, 2018.\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Tesla Model X at a Santa Monica, California showroom on Aug. 8, 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://newsroom.ap.org/detail/CaliforniaElectricCarRebates/2d9f6994ec9f417d8aa3a1604e5833bc/photo?Query=2018%20Tesla%20Model%20X&#38;mediaType=photo&#38;sortBy=arrivaldatetime:desc&#38;dateRange=Anytime&#38;totalCount=44&#38;currentItemNo=0\" target=\"_blank\">Richard Vogel/AP</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>According to iSeeCar's study, the Model X isn't as frequently spotted in the used car market since it was unveiled in 2015. It's also the most expensive used car on the list with an average price of $68,380.</p>\n\t5. Honda Civic — 47.4 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4958687ffa48002894cf29?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Honda Civic 2016\" height=\"3333\" width=\"4444\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 2016 Honda Civic.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Honda</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The Civic has an average used cost of $16,725, securing its position as the second least expensive car on this list.</p>\n\t4. Toyota Yaris\t — 44.8 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49589260bf1f00280794ab?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2018 Toyota Yaris\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 2018 Toyota Yaris.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Toyota</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>According to iSeeCars, the Yaris is popular because it has Toyota's reliability at a lower price: $14,118, on average, for a used version.</p><p>The Yaris is the least expensive vehicle in this compilation.</p>\n\t3. Subaru BRZ — 44.5 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49593d7ffa48002894cf30?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2018 Subaru BRZ\" height=\"1227\" width=\"1636\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A 2018 Subaru BRZ.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://media.subaru.com/image-gallery.do?method=adhoc&#38;imageIds=5104&#38;mid=1&#38;searchresult\" target=\"_blank\">Subaru</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>According to the study, the BRZ &#8212; with its average used price of $20,276 &#8212; doesn't heavily populate the used car market since it has a more \"niche audience.\"</p>\n\t2. BMW X6 — 43 days on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f493e997ffa48002894ce35?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2019 BMW X6.\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2019 BMW X6.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.press.bmwgroup.com/usa/photo/detail/P90356712/the-new-bmw-x6-%E2%80%93-stills-07/2019\" target=\"_blank\">BMW</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>According to iSeeCars, the BMW X6 is one of the quickest depreciating SUVS, giving it a big discount (an average used price of $40,235) in the used car market.</p>\n\t1. Tesla Model 3 — 29.3 days to sell on average\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4959cb60bf1f00280794b5?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tesla Model 3 in 2018.\" height=\"2412\" width=\"3217\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Tesla Model 3 in 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/photo-taken-in-los-angeles-in-november-2018-shows-tesla-inc-news-photo/1128193470?adppopup=true\" target=\"_blank\">Kyodo News via Getty Images</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>\"The Tesla Model 3, which was the automaker's least expensive vehicle, had the highest number of preorders of any car ever produced, and the long wait time helped further drive the high demand for the vehicle which has been sustained in the secondary marketplace,\" Ly said.</p><p>A used Model 3 has an average price tag of $53,776 and a low inventory in the used car market because the electric vehicle was first introduced in 2018, according to iSeeCars.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/10-fastest-selling-used-cars-pandemic-according-to-data-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4959e260bf1f00280794b7?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"2230aa5da32261845d114b9dfb24de0d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn60@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-52-442_bbd851be31a15437.webp","destWidth":1904,"destHeight":1428,"sourceBytes":157680,"destBytes":157680,"author":"bchang@businessinsider.com (Brittany Chang)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f495a0360bf1f00280794bc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn10@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-04-026_74e25cc84fe9789b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f49561a7ffa48002894cf04?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn56@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-01-440_69633cba17922fc7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4936ac60bf1f0028079375?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn60@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-56-372_f4111282150f663a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4956f27ffa48002894cf19?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn36@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-57-725_e9364c1f4efbac34.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f49578360bf1f00280794a1?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn74@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-965_53058ff83ee9f56b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f49584660bf1f00280794a8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn18@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-56-044_03f084865b1708e6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4958687ffa48002894cf29?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn67@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-01-03-185_45019ac2c958a46d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f49589260bf1f00280794ab?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn21@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-53-804_7c08f127364b39bb.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f49593d7ffa48002894cf30?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn43@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-01-01-309_0ef123a95d3eb25b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f493e997ffa48002894ce35?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn85@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-53-562_2a0456ce881dbb24.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4959cb60bf1f00280794b5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn53@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-53-580_28ebfb9e713689ed.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=wl47CTQ2ybs:HzfA168Xrio:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn37@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-53-493_f2ebec0df6367a51.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=wl47CTQ2ybs:HzfA168Xrio:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn72@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-01-672_9477ca1d2f4328d5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/wl47CTQ2ybs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn52@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-284_6d34576939f156aa.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650333},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"An Israeli plan from 1969 to resettle 60,000 Gazans in Paraguay has been uncovered in a declassified state archive","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/gaza-1969-israel-program-to-transfer-60000-palestinians-to-paraguay-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4b643260bf1f0028079615?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gaza Palestinians protest. August 2020\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Palestinians take part in a protest against the United Arab Emirates&#39; deal with Israel to normalise relations, in Gaza City August 14, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Mohammed Salem</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>A secret Israeli plan to resettle 60,000 Palestinians in South America has been discovered in a declassified state archive.</li><li>In 1969 Israel struck a deal with Paraguay, 7,000 miles away, to accept Palestinians from Gaza who wanted to emigrate.</li><li>After the Six-Day War, when millions of Palestinians came under Israel's control, Israel has explored a series of outlandish plans to alter the demographic balance.</li><li>The plan was approved in the same year the Mossad decided to stop hunting Nazi fugitives and architects of the Holocaust, many of whom had found sanctuary in Paraguay.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>A secret Israeli plan to re-settle 60,000 Palestinians living in Gaza to Paraguay has been discovered in a state archive of government papers.</p><p>Eran Mor-Cicurel, a senior reporter with KAN (IPBC) &#8212; Israeli Public Broadcasting Corporation &#8212; said he discovered the lost chapter of Israeli history in \"a pile of old documents\" while trawling through declassified cabinet minutes from 1969.</p><p>\" The extent, the numbers and the methodology was quite amazing, through the eyes of someone who lives in the 21st century,\" he told Business Insider.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f492718cd2fec00296a4cb0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"israel palestine west bank map skitch\" height=\"750\" width=\"1000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A map of Israel, the West Bank, and the Gaza Strip.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider/Google Maps</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>In 1967, Israel captured Gaza, an enclave beside the Mediterranean on its southern border, from Egypt in the Six-Day War. It also occupied Egypt's Sinai peninsula, the Golan Heights that had been part of Syria, and the West Bank, controlled by Jordan.</p><p>Today, Gaza is controlled by Hamas, which is designated a terrorist organization <a href=\"https://www.state.gov/foreign-terrorist-organizations/\">by the US government</a>. The area is the constant conflict flashpoint between Israel and the Palestinians.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/idf-airstrikes-target-terrorist-sites-in-gaza-strip-report-640263\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">In recent days, hostilities have reignited&#160;</a>as Palestinians launched multiple incendiary balloons and rockets across the border. Israel has retaliated with airstrikes.</p><p>For Mor-Cicurel, in 1969, the Israeli government, led by Prime Minister Golda Meir, had an inkling of the conflicts that would follow. However, at the time, relations between Israel and Gazans could not have been more different than the enmity that exists today.&#160;</p><p>\"The Palestinian population (in Gaza) was very peaceful at the time. Israel was a welcome occupier. Israelis were going to Gaza and shopping, sitting on the beach, and talking about how people were friendly. Relations were basically very good at the beginning,\" he said.</p><p>But the Paraguay transfer plan emerged because, \"the Israel government identified the problem in advance,\" he said.</p><p>\"After the '67 war, the Gazan economy was disconnected from the Egyptian economy. There was very high unemployment. In Golda Meir's view, it was a humanistic attempt to solve a difficult problem &#8212; it seemed reasonable.\"</p><h2><strong>Palestinians to Paraguay</strong></h2><p>What to do with the millions of Palestinian Arabs that came under the Jewish state's control after 1967 has been an intense debate in Israeli politics ever since. As recently as 2019, <a href=\"https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-right-wing-resurrects-voluntary-transfer-of-palestinians-despite-50-years-of-fail-1.7735140\">a senior government official said that Israel was willing to help Palestinians emigrate from Gaza</a>.</p><p>One idea that never got off the ground, Mor-Cicurel said, was to establish agricultural settlements in northern Sinai for 50,000 Palestinians. But in reality, there was no local solution, so Israel's leaders, advised by its spy agency, Mossad, began to look further afield.</p><p>&#160;\"Paraguay was basically a dictatorship. You had a strongman there who you could reach an agreement with,\" said Mor-Cicurel.&#160;</p><p>Paraguay was ruled by Alfredo Stroessner, who took power in a military coup in 1954 and ruled until his overthrow in 1989. The period was marked by sustained human rights abuses of opponents.</p><p>The Mossad brokered a secret agreement with the Paraguayan regime.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.kan.org.il/Item/?itemId=75705&fbclid=IwAR1JSxlK6l2aUIeNByxQ4VIKpVVly4oYhdLL-M0uAm-HTsFyDzaEw4-WIi4WIi4\">According to the archived cabinet minutes</a>, the head of the Mossad<strong>, </strong>Major General Zvi Zamir, said: \"The proposal in question is the consent of the Paraguayan government, through the Paraguayan Institute of Agriculture and Immigration, to absorb for a minimum period of four years &#8212; although it can continue longer if things develop &#8212; 60,000 Arab Muslim people, Who by definition are not communists. She is willing to absorb them into the country, When the Government of Israel fulfills certain conditions.\"</p><p>The plan guaranteed Israel would cover the emigrants' travel expenses. It said they would be paid $100 each, plus $33 per person would go to the Paraguay government. On arrival, the Palestinians would receive residency rights, and citizenship after five years.</p><p>\"According to the Israeli state papers, a down payment of $350,000 was made for the first 10,000 emigrants. The total bill for the 60,000 resettled Palestinians was estimated at $33 million.</p><p>\"The idea was to seduce people to leave Gaza,\" said Mor-Circurel.</p><p>To facilitate the movement of the Palestinians, Israel set up a travel agency in Gaza to entice people and provide them with the relevant documentation.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4a64207ffa48002894d045?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Golda Meir. Israel&#39;s prime minister from 1969-1974\" height=\"1414\" width=\"1886\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Golda Meir, Israel&#39;s first and only female prime minister from 1969 and 1974.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Charles Bennett, File</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2>Wishful thinking</h2><p>Through the human rights lens of 2020, the plan may appear shocking, said Mor-Circurel, but the Israeli leadership perspective in the late 1960s was formed from their<a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golda_Meir\">&#160;own historical experience</a>.</p><p>\"Transferring populations from one place to another was common to these people. All of them were basically immigrants. Most of the policymakers came from other countries to the State of Israel,\" he said.</p><p>\"In the eyes of today, the idea of transferring the population is quite strange. But 1968 was not so far away from the division of Pakistan and India and the transfer of populations. It wasn't considered human rights abuse.\"</p><p>The secret Paraguay plan also mingles with the history of the Holocaust. Mor-Circurel points it formed as Israel wound down its hunt for fugitive Nazi war criminals.</p><p>Paraguay was a safe haven for many notorious fugitives from Hitler's Third Reich. Josef Mengele, the so-called \"the angel of death,\" who carried out horrific medical experiments on Jewish <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/auschwitz-photos-nazi-camp-history-liberation-anniversary-2020-1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">prisoners at Auschwitz,</a> was gifted<a href=\"https://www.thejc.com/news/features/an-awkward-friendship-blossoms-between-jerusalem-and-asunci%C3%B3n-israel-paraguay-1.465281?highlight=Paraguay\">&#160;Paraguayan citizenship</a> under his real name in 1959.</p><p>Mor-Circurel believes that Israel made a realpolitik decision that it was better to develop relations with South American countries than continue efforts to hunt down Nazis.</p><p>\"The head of Mossad said it was too expensive to continue the Nazi-hunting operation and it should concentrate on security threats not 'ghosts from the past',\" said Mor-Circurel.</p><p>Only 30 Palestinians ever made the 7,000 thousand-mile journey before the project came to a shuddering halt.</p><p>Two immigrants shot a young clerk at the Israeli Embassy in Asunci&#243;n. <a href=\"https://twitter.com/porazdan/status/1257186895789993985\">This has since been framed as the first act of Palestinian terrorism against Israel abroad.</a></p><p>Mor-Circurel says his research suggests that the motive was more likely they were disgruntled with life in their new South American home. \"It was convenient to claim they were terrorists,\" he said.</p><p>It created a scandal around the Paraguayan resettlement plan, and Stroessner, fearing the Arab world's wrath, aborted the project.</p><p>\"This is an unusual story,\" Professor Colin Shindler of the University of London (SOAS), told Business Insider, by email</p><p>\"It was soon after the Six-Day War and there were no negotiations with the Arab states &#8212; a stalemate. It also coincided with the rise of Palestinian nationalism, Arafat and the PLO,\" he said.</p><p>\"Perhaps they believed that exporting 60,000 Palestinians would help to mitigate the problem. However, 60,000 is such a small number in the context of the population of the West Bank and Gaza that it would have made no difference.</p><p>\"It sounds more like a temporary flight of fancy than a thought through idea. More wishful thinking than confronting the political reality,\" he said.</p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/gaza-1969-israel-program-to-transfer-60000-palestinians-to-paraguay-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a
