src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/BKZFa94y_Xo\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 30 Aug 2020 09:36:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4b643260bf1f0028079615?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"037ea8b386cffc2045c052708bc5c788","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn13@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-50-446_243bbba9de0fa981.webp","destWidth":1777,"destHeight":1333,"sourceBytes":168122,"destBytes":168122,"author":"jkossoff@businessinsider.com (Julian Kossoff)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4b643260bf1f0028079615?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn13@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-50-446_243bbba9de0fa981.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f492718cd2fec00296a4cb0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn17@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-54-684_da09f3794e9304f5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4a64207ffa48002894d045?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn53@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-54-915_8a07181b1bb84272.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=BKZFa94y_Xo:bn1fOh9LjS4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn77@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-57-945_04bd5d11af9a6b6d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=BKZFa94y_Xo:bn1fOh9LjS4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn38@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-00-598_ce6cf41ef13c73a4.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/BKZFa94y_Xo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn55@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-00-56-308_0bf84bc2cceef0d6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650336},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"I'm a trauma psychologist. Here's how I'm taking care of myself during the pandemic.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trauma-psychologist-how-im-taking-care-of-myself-during-pandemic-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ebbd65c3dac9a4fe034fbe7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Virtual Coffee\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2223\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">damircudic/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Paula Madrid is a clinical and forensic psychologist who specializes in trauma; she's assisted in a variety of disaster response efforts and is adjunct faculty at&#160;<a href=\"https://ncdp.columbia.edu/\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"aaa3f0b0b360fda7d5e5f865e8260366\">Columbia University's National Center for Disaster Preparedness</a>.</li><li>She already had a packed schedule pre-pandemic &#8212; and self-care routines that involved going out for happy hours and working out with a personal trainer.</li><li>Now those things aren't possible, so she's readjusted.</li><li>She's fulfilled her New Year's resolution to learn French by logging on to a virtual French lesson every morning at 7 a.m.</li><li>She's also found that dinner &#8212; and its preparation &#8212; has become a sacred time.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>A very good friend who knows my schedule well has affectionately labeled me a \"working soccer mom.\"&#160;</p><p>I run two businesses and (pre-pandemic) drove my daughter to school daily, picked her up, and took her to lessons three times a week. I had found it quite challenging to find regular time for self-care routines. Pre-pandemic, most weeks I found time to fit in a training session with the amazing personal trainer Ador Orca, happy hour with \"the girls\" on Wednesday evenings, and at least three work-free weekends per month. Such luxuries are hardly tenable in the current climate.&#160;&#160;</p><p>At the outset of the pandemic, I contemplated ways I could remain active and positive while continuing to have a challenging schedule &#8212; now also occupied with homeschooling &#8212; while putting aside some time for new culinary ventures at home.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Since about April 15, I have managed to get a simple routine down that's worked wonders for me. I attribute this success to drawing from my innermost desires, rather than basing my choices on what others typically say self-care \"should be\" all about.</p><p>Self-care is very personal. It requires an intimate understanding of one's true wants and needs, and then going for it! It can change on a weekly or even daily basis and thus requires some real introspection and lots of planning.</p><p>Here's how my routine works:</p><h2>6-8 a.m.: I set an alarm for 6 a.m. so that I can actually get myself up by 6:45 most mornings.</h2><p>After a quick shower and a relaxed dressing (except for Fridays, when I actually wear PJ's until around 11 a.m.), I prepare a cup of earl gray in preparation for a 7 a.m. virtual French language lesson. This has become one of my most important self-care rituals during this COVID era.&#160;</p><p>On December 31, 2019, I held a New Year's Eve party at home. When friends asked about New Year's resolutions, I replied that I was set on becoming fluent in French and growing my secondary business. Fast forward to August 23, 2020: When I listen to podcasts in French, I can actually understand what's being said!&#160;</p><p>Believe me, it's a rare pleasure to be able to follow through on a goal like this. What began in my mind as a lofty ambition &#8212; a \"would be nice\" scenario &#8212; has progressed into real achievement in the midst of this unfortunate crisis.&#160;</p><p>Actually following through on a seemingly fanciful but long-held aim has filled me with a unique joy, and allowed me to note real changes in the way I see myself; it has engendered a strong sense of self-confidence I never knew I could draw from.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</p><h2>8 a.m.-6 p.m.: My days are full of calls, emails, organizing meals, overseeing an active seven-year-old, delegating tasks to my associates and staff, composing reports, and putting out fires of a seemingly limitless variety &#8212; all of which results in me feeling a good deal overwhelmed, especially as this multi-tasking is ever-changing.&#160;&#160;</h2><p>I have found that, more than ever, having set to-do lists has been a lifesaver. I have a list of daily musts, which I prepare the night before, as well as ongoing lists of important &#8212; sometimes urgent &#8212; tasks to be performed at some specified time.&#160;</p><p>This helps me stay sane, focused, and feel a sense of accomplishment on a daily basis, as a once-dreaded pastiche of tasks is reduced to checklist items. Each line drawn through a completed task yields a sense of satisfaction.</p><h2>7-9 p.m.: The dinner hours have become quite the sacred time.</h2><p>I have found a new love in preparing dinner with my family. I myself am a master veggie-chopper, our 7-year-old is an ace at salad dressing, and my husband has perfected the art of producing what my daughter has labeled \"heavenly chicken.\" We use this time to laugh, tell jokes, play loud music or give each other dance lessons, plan where our next vacation might be (one day), as well as share about our days.&#160;</p><h2>~10 p.m.: After much joking around and a heavy dose of either Food Network watching or Harry Potter reading, our daughter finally falls asleep.</h2><p>Success!&#160;</p><h2>11 p.m.: I do a bit more work and prepare for bed.</h2><p>Composing a list of the wonderful things I experienced during the day, I realize I am smiling as I do so. I find that gratitude keeps me in a positive frame of mind, aware of how fortunate we are and have been, and how much we can offer to others in need.&#160;</p><p>We are healthy, and we have basic needs covered, friends and family we can count on, and the freedom to dream about the future with the serene optimism of security. Indeed, we are just about as fortunate as it gets. Time to turn on a French podcast and fall asleep smiling because I actually understand what is being said.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 6},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway reveals $6 billion investment in 5 Japanese giants","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/warren-buffett-reveals-6-billion-investment-5-japanese-companies-2020-8","description":"<p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4c5e417ffa48002894d157?format=jpeg\" alt=\"warren buffett\" height=\"745\" width=\"1491\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bill Pugliano/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><ul><li><strong>Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway disclosed a $6 billion bet on five of Japan's biggest trading companies in a <a href=\"https://www.berkshirehathaway.com/news/aug3020.pdf\">press release on Sunday night</a>.</strong></li><li><strong>The billionaire investor's company revealed that it owns just over 5% of Mitsubishi, Mitsui, Itochu, Marubeni, and Sumitomo.</strong></li><li><strong>\"I am delighted to have Berkshire Hathaway participate in the future of Japan and the five companies we have chosen for investment,\" Buffett said in the statement.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><p>Warren Buffett <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/warren-buffett-90th-birthday-stories-sees-candies-geico-berkshire-hathaway-2020-8-1029545669\">marked his 90th birthday on Sunday</a> by revealing a $6 billion investment in five of Japan's largest trading companies.</p><p>The famed investor's Berkshire Hathaway conglomerate has built passive stakes of just over 5% in each of Itochu, Marubeni, Mitsubishi, Mitsui, and Sumitomo over the past 12 months, it said in a <a href=\"https://www.berkshirehathaway.com/news/aug3020.pdf\">press release</a>. Its National Indemnity subsidiary made the investments and will officially notify Japanese regulators of the positions when trading begins on Monday.</p><p>\"I am delighted to have Berkshire Hathaway participate in the future of Japan and the five companies we have chosen for investment,\" Buffett said in the press release.</p><p>\"The five major trading companies have many joint ventures throughout the world and are likely to have more of these partnerships,\" he continued. \"I hope that in the future there may be opportunities of mutual benefit.\"</p><p>Shares in Itochu, Marubeni, Mitsubishi, Mitsui, and Sumitomo all rose by more than 5% in early trading on Monday.</p><p>Buffett's company highlighted its longstanding positions in Coca-Cola, American Express, and Moody's in the statement, underscoring its intention to maintain the Japanese investments for the long term.&#160;</p><p>Berkshire has the option to boost its stakes as high as 9.9% in any of the five companies. Buffett pledged to seek approval from the relevant board of directors to raise it beyond that point.</p><p>Investing in Japanese companies is a departure from the norm for Berkshire, as it has historically favored American businesses such as Apple and Bank of America. However, it has made a few foreign bets on companies such as Brazilian payments group StoneCo.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4c5e5660bf1f00280796a4?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"fbcc989cb83bd5c41ee4826f2608d8e9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn92@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-52-370_0978c2a5b3b6dd8c.webp","destWidth":1240,"destHeight":930,"sourceBytes":52936,"destBytes":52936,"author":"tmohamed@businessinsider.com (Theron Mohamed)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4c5e417ffa48002894d157?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn89@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-55-885_baa1ef69a2eb4f1c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=MY0-UtJx5Ik:MYZ-P0XrfEE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn31@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-968_4b80688ce21a3689.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=MY0-UtJx5Ik:MYZ-P0XrfEE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/MY0-UtJx5Ik":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn66@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-55-753_2249a5123b434a54.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650318},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"The 14 best rosés to try this summer, according to wine experts","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-roses-to-try-summer-according-to-wine-experts","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5582f21f6bb3f7801899268e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"rose wine\" height=\"2587\" width=\"3450\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rosé tends to be the drink of the summer — but experts said it&#39;s a great wine for any time of year.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>As summer approaches, so too nears the time to begin stocking your fridge with one of the season's favorite adult beverages: ros&#233;.</li><li>If you're new to the pink wine, experts recommend trying out a variety of hues from pale to deep to discover what most pleases your palate.</li><li>If you're looking for something to complement your fruit and cheese picnic, try a pale Provencal; if you need a pairing for a seafood dinner, go for a robust California bottle.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>With Memorial Day in the rearview mirror, we are officially in the fast lane to summer.</p><p>And what does summer signal? Ros&#233; on rooftops, of course.</p><p>While this summer you may be sipping your ros&#233; on your own rooftop with a mask firmly at your side, choosing the right ros&#233; can certainly elevate any self-isolation experience, transforming your personal space into a Provencal paradise.&#160;</p><p>\"For folks that may be new to ros&#233;, I would encourage them to try a few different hues,\" said Andy Myers, wine director at Jose Andres Think Food Group. \"Try a pale Provencal one, a blushing Spanish, and a rich, dark US version. See what you like.\"</p><p>He adds that ros&#233;s should ideally be dry &#8212; anywhere from 12.5% ABV or higher is a dry ros&#233; &#8212; and loaded with fresh, vibrant fruits like strawberries and raspberries.</p><p>A note from our experts: While we tend to think of warm weather as \"ros&#233; season,\" our experts unanimously agree that there is no such thing, and a great ros&#233; can be enjoyed any time of year. The taste of a good ros&#233; can give us something to look forward to and transport us to a beautiful afternoon at any time of year &#8212; which may be just the dose of optimism we need right about now.</p><p>\"The biggest misconception about ros&#233; is that it's only for warm-weather enjoyment. The truth is that ros&#233; is fantastic year round,\" said Brian Freedman, a wine, spirits, food, and travel writer. He consults on restaurants, is a drinks educator, event host, speaker, and regular wine contributor for Food &#38; Wine Magazine.</p><p>\"In fact, I love opening a bottle on a snowy evening in the dead of winter. It's my own little protest against the cold and the dark, and a wonderful reminder that better days are sure to come,\" Freedman added. Well said!</p><p>Anyway, shall we get on with it? Whether you're spread out on a picnic blanket in your own backyard or staring longingly out of your apartment window in the city, these are 14 of the best ros&#233;s to try this summer, according to our experts.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\t1. Liquid Geography\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed160644dca68256263ac25?format=jpeg\" alt=\"liquid geography rose\" height=\"1800\" width=\"1440\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Liquid Geography Rosé.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Liquid Geography</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This is a ros&#233; from Rioja that hasn't quite reached the US yet, but will be launching here in just a few months.</p><p>\"It's a delicious Garnacha-based ros&#233;,\" said Myers. \"The best part is that <a href=\"https://www.oleobrigado.com/\">Ole &#38; Obrigado Imports</a> is donating 50% of the profits to World Central Kitchen,\" a charity started by Jose Andres that helps battle global hunger.</p><p>\"Pairing ros&#233; is easy,\" he added. \"Serve it with happiness. Most ros&#233;s are uncomplicated, easy, and fun. They tend to get along with everything from fresh veggies to hearty meats. Don't overthink it.\"</p>\n\t2. Chateau d'Esclans Whispering Angel Rose 2019\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed113a6f34d0575da657065?format=jpeg\" alt=\"whispering angel\" height=\"6144\" width=\"1740\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Whispering Angel.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Chateau d&#39;Esclans</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you're a rooftop ros&#233; veteran, chances are you've heard of <a href=\"https://drizly.com/wine/rose-wine/whispering-angel-rose/p19586\">Whispering Angel</a>. This is the ros&#233; that made most Americans fall for the Provencal style.&#160;</p><p>\"Great ros&#233;s are being made in almost every wine region, but I have a particular affinity for ros&#233;s from the South of France,\" said Gillian Sciaretta, associate editor at Wine Spectator. \"Provence is arguably the most important region in the world for ros&#233;, and many winemakers outside of France strive to make Provencal-styled wines.\"&#160;</p><p>What sets a Provencal ros&#233; apart? Its flavors of citrus, red berry, melon, tangerine, spice, herb, and wet stone. Ros&#233;s from Provence are dry and have minerals as well. Pair them with seafood and summer salads, Sciaretta added.</p>\n\t3. 2019 Minuty Rosé et Or\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed113edf34d05762755d964?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Rose &#38; Or\" height=\"7500\" width=\"5000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rose et Or.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Chateau Minuty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://drizly.com/wine/rose-wine/minuty-rose-et-or/p71034\">This is a ros&#233;</a> that beautifully captures the Chateau Minuty Saint-Tropez estate. It also happens to be the best ros&#233; wine among Vivino users, with a 4.3-star rating.</p><p>\"[It] speaks of the seaside with its freshness and flavors and represents the ultimate in what a quality Cotes de Provence ros&#233; can achieve,\" said Joel Anthony Caruso, Vivino's partner sommelier and beverage educator. \"Its gentle freshness gives way to concentrated, almost gourmet flavors.\"</p>\n\t4. 2019 Cotes de Provence Rose Tentations Clos Cibonne\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed114e0f0f41964ea6bbe9d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"cibenne tentations rose\" height=\"1024\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Rose Tentations Clos Cibonne.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Clos Cibonne</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>From the Tibouren varietal, <a href=\"https://www.clos-cibonne.com/gb/accueil.html\">this is a ros&#233;</a> that offers a little twist on the traditional.</p><p>\"A geeky ros&#233; option for those looking for something different,\" said Brian Phillips, acting general manager and sommelier for The Citrus Club and former wine director for Darden Restaurant Group. \"It's very expressive of the Provencal Mediterranean climate and environment, but the unique Tibouren varietal wine delivers a complex bouquet of flavors apart from the more common cuvee of Provence.\"</p><p>Phillips recommended sipping Clos Cibonne with richer dishes, from seafood stews to assorted aged cheeses.</p>\n\t5. Sofia Brut Rosé 2019, Francis Ford Coppola Winery\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed64eff2618b9732a346a25?format=jpeg\" alt=\"sofia brut rose\" height=\"3291\" width=\"1145\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sofia Brut Rosé.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of FCC Winery</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you're in the mood for something celebratory, a sparkling ros&#233; pairs perfectly with a festive occasion. And these days, we certainly could use a few more reasons to celebrate.</p><p>Phillips recommended the <a href=\"https://www.totalwine.com/wine/champagne-sparkling-wine/sparkling-wine/sofia-brut-rose/p/195462750-1?glia=true&#38;s=303&#38;pid=cpc:utm_source=Google:utm_campaign=Shopping%2BUS%2BNEWJ%2BENG%2BSPART:utm_term=&#38;gclid=CjwKCAjw5cL2BRASEiwAENqAPgPKGSFGnqp-YNlAWmhpZTQuV3RsNKLRCaJgipnBuno3CpjUBkm1cRoClfcQAvD_BwE&#38;gclsrc=aw.ds\">Sofia Brut Ros&#233;</a> for its hint of off-dry sweetness. Fun fact: It's available in both bottles and cans.&#160;</p><p>\"Pair this with any water time recreation or chilling on a summer day,\" he said. \"Its bubbles and touch of sweetness are perfect on their own as a great refresher.\"</p>\n\t6. Le Charmel Provence 2019\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed114533ad86102ea756e99?format=jpeg\" alt=\"le charmel\" height=\"2688\" width=\"950\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Le Charmel Rosé.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Le Charmel</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For Melvyn Master, proprietor of Le Charmel, Mont Gravet, Exem, Tortoise Creek, Kin &#38; Cascadia, and Tiamo Organic, ros&#233; should always be from Provence or the south of France. In particular, this year he's excited for his <a href=\"https://drizly.com/wine/rose-wine/le-charmel-rose/p17605\">Le Charmel Provence</a>.</p><p>\"I think these styles of ros&#233; can be enjoyed alone, but their versatility allows them to be all occasion wines,\" he said. \"For newbies, I would always choose something that is from the south of France, as these wines are the most representative of ros&#233; at its best.\"</p>\n\t7. Domaines Ott 'BY.OTT' Rosé\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed115112618b97c33541208?format=jpeg\" alt=\"BY OTT 2019 rose\" height=\"5760\" width=\"3632\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>BY.OTT Rosé.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Domaines Ott</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Freedman has tasted more than 120 different ros&#233;s for the 2020 season, so you can trust his judgment when he recommends&#160;<a href=\"https://www.wine.com/product/domaines-ott-byott-rose-2019/599226?state=NY&#38;s=GoogleBase_CSE_599226NY_type_Wine_RosWine_Ros_1409&#38;utm_source=google&#38;utm_medium=cpc&#38;utm_term=&#38;utm_campaign=Google_Shopping_NY_Smart_Relaunch&#38;showpromo=true&#38;promo=PSCASE10&#38;gclid=CjwKCAjw5cL2BRASEiwAENqAPknfi3TqDn9TI5y-1j50UB3Kcv1Q1Ml5CxKfVLtaxRduWdIOcSENtxoCNMsQAvD_BwE&#38;gclsrc=aw.ds#promoBarModal\">Domaines Ott \"BY.OTT\"</a> ros&#233; from Cotes de Provence.&#160;</p><p>\"Like a lot of people, my wine drinking time has definitely shifted to earlier in the day as quarantine has worn on,\" he said. Ros&#233; is perfect for that, as it's light enough to be enjoyed well before 5 p.m. \"The classic pairing is ros&#233; with Nicoise salad, but I love it with everything from canned sardines to potato chips to grilled hot dogs,\" he explained.</p><p>Pro tip: Freedman's preferred ros&#233; meal is Hebrew Nationals on a Martin's potato roll topped with sauerkraut, relish, and mustard.</p><p>\"Great ros&#233; pairs with it perfectly,\" he said. \"My only complaint is that the bottle tends to vanish way more quickly than I ever expected.\"</p>\n\t8. Anne Amie Twelve Oaks Estate Rosé of Pinot Gris 2019 Willamette Valley\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed115555af6cc77eb261fca?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Anne Amie_RoseofPinotGris Anne Amie Twelve Oaks Estate Rosé of Pinot Gris rose\" height=\"3000\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Anne Amie Twelve Oaks Estate Rosé of Pinot Gris 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Anne Amie Twelve Oaks Estate</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For something a little richer, Freedman recommended the <a href=\"https://drizly.com/wine/rose-wine/anne-amie-twelve-oaks-pinot-gris-rose/p96669\">Anne Amie Twelve Oaks Estate Ros&#233;</a>, which is copper in color and has notes of caramel, dried pineapples, tarragon, and lime juice.</p><p>\"Personally, there are times when I want a richer style of ros&#233;, something a bit more extracted, and others when I crave that classic, delicate, detailed Provencal style. The good news is that you can find it all with relative ease,\" he said.</p>\n\t9. JNSQ Rosé Cru\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed1157a4dca6877f76030cd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JNSQ_750ml_Rose_Hero_Rgb_F_Smaller jnsq rose\" height=\"4000\" width=\"2667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>JNSQ Rosé Cru.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of JNSQ</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For a touch of style and unique presentation, master sommelier Joe Spellmen recommended <a href=\"https://www.jnsq.com/products/rose-cru-wine\">JNSQ</a> (\"je ne sais quois\"). Sourced from vineyards all over the California central coast, this ros&#233; is based on Grenache.&#160;</p><p>\"Its 'secret sauce,'\" he revealed, \"is a very small percentage of Viognier to bump up the floral character of the nose. It's a delightful wine with fine food like steamed lobster, saut&#233;ed scallops, or by itself for celebratory occasions.\"</p>\n\t10. JUSTIN Rosé 2019\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed115a65af6cc786a19bb4f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Justin_2019_750ml_Rose_rgb JUSTIN Rosé 2019\" height=\"2000\" width=\"612\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>JUSTIN Rosé 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of JUSTIN</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This <a href=\"https://www.justinwine.com/shop/wines/white/2019-rose.html\">delicate-hued ros&#233;</a> uses Syrah as the main event.</p><p>\"It is a firm and dry wine,\" Spellman said. \"With just a touch of white pepper and fresh apple in its attractive aromas, it's a great aperitif with charcuterie or fine farmstead cheeses.\"</p>\n\t11. Arnot-Roberts Rosé California 2019\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed115ce988ee30deb42ce35?format=jpeg\" alt=\"30416 arnot roberts rose\" height=\"1008\" width=\"504\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Arnot-Roberts Rosé.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Arnot-Roberts</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For Christopher Hoel, expert curator for Wine Insiders and Martha Stewart Wine Co., founder of <a href=\"https://www.harpersclub.com/\">Harper's Club</a>, and former wine director at French Laundry, you can find great ros&#233; from all over the world, but in an oversaturated market where much of it <em>isn't</em> worth sipping, it can be hard to navigate the shelves.&#160;</p><p>\"Domestically, I like Arnot-Roberts,\" he said. \"They do a funky ros&#233; based on one of the staple grapes in the production of port, but they do it in a very delicate style.\" <a href=\"https://www.wine.com/product/arnot-roberts-touriga-nacional-rose-2019/596930\">It's a pale-style ros&#233;</a>, which is odd coming from one of the thickest skin grapes out there, but it's one that he absolutely loves.</p>\n\t12. Viña Tondonia Rosé Gran Reserva 2009, Lopez de Heredia\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed117492618b97eba224c13?format=jpeg\" alt=\"vina tondonia rosado gran reserva 1459016 s454 (1)\" height=\"560\" width=\"410\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Viña Tondonia Rosé Gran Reserva 2009.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Lopez de Heredia</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you really want to mix it up, as many of these wine experts suggested you do with your ros&#233;, <a href=\"http://www.lopezdeheredia.com/indexgb.html\">Lopez de Heredia</a> is a wine producer in Rioja that's creating some fabulous ros&#233;. Their vintage ros&#233; is aged in American barrels for four years, and then another four years in the bottle. If you know anything about ros&#233;, that may seem wild to you, but according to Hoel, it's a must-try.</p><p>\"The current vintage is impossible to get,\" he said. Not because it's expensive, but because it's rare. In fact, he said it's not even that expensive, just a tough one to discover.</p><p>\"It is one of the most amazing ros&#233; experiences you'll ever have. If you see it somewhere, buy it and call me,\" he added.&#160;&#160;</p>\n\t13. Miraval\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ee3abe53ad86125be40fda4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"19441684_1588446194502006_3951946608087649437_o\" height=\"1080\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Miraval</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>For that classic, mineral, Provencal-style rose, Phillips recommends Miraval, particularly for its wild herb notes and crisp, dry finish.<br /><br />\"Miraval is great on its own,\" he says, \"but it's ideal with seafood, as its crunchy mineralogy and light pink hue complements fresh and briny flavors of the sea.\"<br /><br />With rose, he adds, be on the lookout for the latest vintage. For 2020 we should be looking for 2019. Only in rare cases does a rose improve with age.</p>\n\t14. 2017 Jean-Yves Péron 'Vers la Maison Rouge'\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49515360bf1f0028079456?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2017 Jean-Yves Péron &#39;Vers la Maison Rouge&#39;\" height=\"1239\" width=\"1652\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>2017 Jean-Yves Péron &#39;Vers la Maison Rouge&#39;.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Winery Jean-Yves Péron</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>This particular ros&#233; is a party in a bottle. Why? Because they only bottle it in Magnum. And once you taste it, you may have a tough time putting it away.&#160;</p><p>\"This is a super fresh, bright, and fruity ros&#233; made of the Savoie varietal, Mondeuse, with a dash of Gamay,\" said Billy Smith, sommelier and assistant wine director at Michelin-starred The Four Horsemen restaurant in Brooklyn.&#160;</p><p>Smith attributes the fruity, yet acidic, flavors to the high altitude vineyards, which makes this dark ros&#233; completely dry.&#160;</p><p>\"One regular-sized bottle would just be a disappointment,\" he added.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the 20:25:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/53fe3f08ecad047358ccb61d?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"a191db12d6524f07d45a9b2d46171b72","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn55@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-52-401_585225d24109707f.webp","destWidth":3450,"destHeight":2587,"sourceBytes":207354,"destBytes":207354,"author":"insider@insider.com (Meagan Drillinger)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5582f21f6bb3f7801899268e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn34@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-53-734_d46c36c7aa9b20c9.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed160644dca68256263ac25?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn82@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-56-564_c9f1bf296b00e9dd.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed113a6f34d0575da657065?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn58@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-57-025_18e2e8587fc0eb5e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed113edf34d05762755d964?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn31@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-59-107_ff540eb30a4d779a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed114e0f0f41964ea6bbe9d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn77@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-452_8bd00df03fc95059.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed64eff2618b9732a346a25?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn95@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-01-00-116_5fa8c0e0fcb98633.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed114533ad86102ea756e99?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn78@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-59-447_5b0dfe188e30d14d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed115112618b97c33541208?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn25@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-54-727_f594e1e23adac3f9.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed115555af6cc77eb261fca?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn69@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-57-780_68a14856876843bd.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed1157a4dca6877f76030cd?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn70@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-57-184_b71f08ac1ba2304c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed115a65af6cc786a19bb4f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn46@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-55-599_2398820ade35edcc.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed115ce988ee30deb42ce35?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn79@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-00-873_146e898fa9e5e985.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ed117492618b97eba224c13?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn65@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-01-02-210_024c4eb6b0430f4d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee3abe53ad86125be40fda4?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5f49515360bf1f0028079456?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn30@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-01-02-712_52f4ee9ae1e9108c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=5n1pMJtkINE:FemDniv8V_4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn82@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-00-54-344_739886dbcead2d45.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=5n1pMJtkINE:FemDniv8V_4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn30@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-54-785_67950faa12eb64cf.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/5n1pMJtkINE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn81@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-00-54-964_71c99240107c0c50.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650321},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"If they want to stop the recession from getting worse, the GOP needs to focus less on helping big corporations and more on getting aid to state and local governments","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/coronavirus-aid-bill-congress-gop-state-local-government-economy-recession-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f3ed7e09f3aff00288eee71?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell\" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Republicans leaders say they&#39;ll soon unveil details for the next coronavirus stimulus.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ting Shen/Xinhua via Getty) (Xinhua/ via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>More than ever, Americans are depending on Congress for COVID-19 relief.</li><li>However, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and the GOP seem to be more interested in aiding corporations than getting aid to places that need it most.</li><li>Budget crises for state and local governments can slow the economic recovery, as we saw after the Great Recession.</li><li>So Congress should include a substantial aid package to state and local governments in a new coronavirus aid bill.</li><li>Margarida Jorge is the Executive Director of Health Care for American Now (HCAN)</li><li>This is an opinion column. The thoughts expressed are those of the author.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Americans are depending on Congress to take more action in the coming weeks to provide immediate relief from the tremendous consequences of COVID-19.</p><p>Yet, as the need for basic services like healthcare, unemployment insurance, and food assistance escalates, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell and the Senate GOP are more focused on providing<a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/gop-senators-move-ahead-with-coronavirus-liability-plan-11594929198\"> big corporations with liability</a> insurance and setting arbitrary limits on relief funding than helping average Americans respond to the worst health and economic crisis in a century.</p><p>McConnell is refusing to include adequate<a href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/senate/494612-mcconnell-state-bankruptcy-remarks-raise-constitutional-questions\"> funding to help states and localities struggling with budget shortfalls due to COVID-19 in the next relief package</a>, despite clear evidence that without it, states are not equipped to combat the pandemic or recover from economic downturn.&#160;</p><p>The GOP leader is claiming that the funds can't be included because it would drive up the price tag on the bail and future generations would face too great a burden from more federal spending. But past recessions have shown that failure to adequately fund state and local governments hinders recovery and puts the future at risk for all of us.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.brookings.edu/articles/state-and-local-budgets-and-the-great-recession/\">Dropping public sector employment</a>, curtailed services, and other consequences of underfunding state and local governments <a href=\"https://www.epi.org/blog/without-federal-aid-many-state-and-local-governments-could-make-the-same-budget-cuts-that-hampered-the-last-economic-recovery/\">deepened the Great Recession</a> and continue to be <a href=\"https://www.urban.org/urban-wire/great-recessions-lessons-state-and-local-aids-importance-combating-economic-downturn-and-supporting-children\">a problem to this day</a>.</p><h2>Debt hypocrisy</h2><p>McConnell's concerns about future generations also ring hollow given the massive tax giveaways he's supported.&#160;</p><p>He didn't lament adding to the national debt when he passed the 2017 tax cut law law that gave away $1.9 trillion in tax breaks mainly to the rich and corporations. Nor was he worried about the future when<a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/26/business/coronavirus-real-estate-investors-stimulus.html\"> he gave real estate tycoons and hedge fund managers $135 billion</a> in the CARES package.&#160;</p><p>In the first three months of the pandemic, wealth for billionaires actually grew by<a href=\"https://americansfortaxfairness.org/wp-content/uploads/2020-7-16-Billionaires-Wealth-Gains-Top-700-Billion.pdf\"> $700 billion</a> even as record job loss and economic hardship swept the nation.&#160;</p><p>While<a href=\"https://www.sfchronicle.com/business/article/More-than-50-million-have-filed-for-unemployment-15412510.php\"> more than 50 million people have filed unemployment claims</a> since the beginning of the coronavirus outbreak and<a href=\"https://www.familiesusa.org/resources/the-covid-19-pandemic-and-resulting-economic-crash-have-caused-the-greatest-health-insurance-losses-in-american-history/\"> over 5 million have lost health coverage</a>, the top 1% are getting another tax break averaging $1.6 million just this year. McConnell and his Republican allies slipped the giveaway into the last relief bill by re-opening a loophole that benefits<a href=\"https://www.whitehouse.senate.gov/news/release/whitehouse-doggett-release-new-analysis-showing-gop-tax-provisions-in-cares-act-overwhelmingly-benefit-million-dollar-plus-earners\"> 43,000 business owners making more than $1 million annually</a>.</p><p>It's the height of hypocrisy when Republicans in Congress wail about the deficit while handing out favors to the richest households and corporations while millions of their constituents are facing<a href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/finance/507754-enhanced-unemployment-insurance-likely-to-expire-during-coronavirus-aid-talks\"> joblessness, hunger, and sickness.</a>&#160;</p><p>That hypocrisy points to the bigger deficit in their priorities: instead of passing relief and recovery that is commensurate with what real people need to get through this crisis and for the country to beat COVID, these politicians are putting their rich donors and corporate shareholders ahead of the rest of us.&#160;</p><h2>States need help, now</h2><p>Now,<a href=\"https://www.cbpp.org/research/state-budget-and-tax/states-need-significantly-more-fiscal-relief-to-slow-the-emerging-deep\"> state revenue is plummeting</a> due to job losses resulting in less money from income taxes and diminished sales tax revenue at the same time the burden of COVID-19 is increasing.&#160; State budget shortfalls will force more cuts to jobs and to services at the same time that states are still struggling to contain the pandemic, deepening the crisis and putting recovery further out of reach.&#160;</p><p>We've seen this cycle before: during the last recession, failure to address the budget needs of state and local governments resulted in<a href=\"https://www.americanprogress.org/issues/economy/news/2020/04/17/483461/coronavirus-recovery-demands-substantial-durable-aid-state-local-governments/\"> weak recovery</a> and a longer recession, prolonged struggles for more people and diminished opportunities for future generations. A<a href=\"https://www.nga.org/policy-communications/letters-nga/governors-letter-regarding-covid-19-aid-request/\"> bipartisan letter</a> from the National Governors' Association noted that state and local governments require at least an additional $500 billion in federal funds for COVID relief.&#160; Yet McConnell has delayed taking action since May even as deadlines for unemployment insurance relief approach.</p><p>Hedge fund managers, real estate moguls, pass-through owners and corporate shareholders on the other hand aren't worried about eviction, feeding their families, losing insurance or paying the bill because thanks to McConnell, the<a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/21/american-billionaires-got-434-billion-richer-during-the-pandemic.html\"> rich are getting richer</a> off the pandemic.&#160;</p><p>If the federal government can afford billions in tax breaks for rich and corporations--even in a worldwide pandemic that has already killed more than 170,000 Americans--then we can also afford to give ailing families and the local governments they depend on the resources they need to combat COVID and recover quickly.</p><p>Americans are tired of lip service, delays, half-measures and excuses. It's time for Sen. McConnell and President Trump to make the future of struggling families, seniors, people with disabilities, frontline essential workers and others a higher priority than their rich donors and corporate cronies.</p><p><em>Margarida Jorge is the Executive Director of Health Care for American Now (HCAN)</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 28},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"The yellow Rolls-Royce driven by Robert Redford in 'The Great Gatsby' could fetch $2 million at auction — take a closer look at the famed car","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/rolls-royce-used-in-the-great-gatsby-up-for-auction-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d60bf1f0028079493?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_15\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>The 1928 Rolls-Royce 40/50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton used in the 1974 film \"The Great Gatsby\" is headed to auction via Classic Promenade Auctions.</li><li>From 2011 to 2019, it underwent a ground-up restoration that cost $1.2 million.</li><li>It is estimated to sell for between $1.5 million and $2 million.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Scott Fitzgerald fans rejoice: You'll soon have a shot at owning the iconic yellow Rolls-Royce famously featured in the 1974 film \"The Great Gatsby,\" which starred Robert Redford and Mia Farrow.&#160;</p><p>The 1928 Rolls-Royce 40/50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton <a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\">will be auctioned through Classic Promenade Auctions</a> starting on Monday, October 12, <a href=\"https://www.hagerty.com/media/auctions/redfords-great-gatsby-rolls-could-be-yours-just-dont-let-daisy-drive-it/\">Hagerty</a> first reported. An emailed press release claims that this example is believed to be the only Ascot Sport Phaeton built with the dual cowl to match the description in <em>The Great Gatsby</em>: \"&#8230;terraced with a labyrinth of windshields that mirrored a dozen suns.\"&#160;&#160;</p><p>In the interest of accuracy, the car was repainted in this creamy yellow color and its interior dyed green in order for it to make its film debut.&#160;</p><p>Classic Promenade is giving the car a pre-sale estimate of between $1.5 million and $2 million. Keep scrolling to see more.</p>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThis 1928 Rolls-Royce 40/50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton is the one famously used in the 1974 film “The Great Gatsby.”\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565e7ffa48002894cf0e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_11\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn the movie, the car is driven by Jay Gatsby, who was played by Robert Redford.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f495aa67ffa48002894cf41?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_18\" height=\"1514\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40/50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAuthor F. Scott Fitzgerald gave Gatsby a Rolls-Royce because it represented the utter opulence and extravagance that the character surrounded himself with.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d7ffa48002894cf08?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_2\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn the book, it is described as having “a rich cream color, bright with nickel” and “a sort of green leather conservatory.”\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565c7ffa48002894cf05?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_4\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tFor the movie, the car was repainted yellow and its interior dyed green to match the book’s description.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565c7ffa48002894cf06?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_3\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt will soon be up for online auction through Classic Promenade Auctions, which is based on Phoenix, Arizona.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d7ffa48002894cf07?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_5\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\">You can view the listing here</a>.</p>\n\tThe car underwent a ground-up restoration between 2011 and 2019.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565c60bf1f0028079491?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_6\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIn total, the cost of the restoration was about $1.2 million.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d7ffa48002894cf0a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_7\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt was even shown at the 2019 Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d7ffa48002894cf09?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_8\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe car has appeared with Redford on magazine covers, as well as in GQ and Vogue articles.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565c60bf1f0028079490?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_1\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBecause of its big-screen fame, literary association, and restoration, this is a Rolls-Royce unlike any other.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d7ffa48002894cf0c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_9\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tClassic Promenade gives the car a pre-sale estimate of between $1.5 million and $2 million.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d7ffa48002894cf0b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_10\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tIt shows 73,848 miles on the clock.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565e7ffa48002894cf10?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_16\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tAnd looks to be truly a massive car in person.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d7ffa48002894cf0d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_12\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe car was originally delivered to and owned by Mildred Loring Logan of New York City.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565e7ffa48002894cf0f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_13\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tLater on, it was owned by George Washington Hill, the president of American Tobacco Company.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d60bf1f0028079492?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_14\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tThe Gatsby Rolls will be available via online auction from Monday, October 12, through Sunday, October 25.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565d60bf1f0028079493?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_15\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.classicpromenade.com/car/rolls_royce_phantom_i_ascot_phaeton_gatsby_redford/\" target=\"_blank\">Courtesy of Classic Promenade</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t\n\tBidding begins at 10 a.m. PST.\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49565e7ffa48002894cf11?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1928 Rolls Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton_17\" height=\"1296\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>1928 Rolls-Royce 40:50hp Phantom I Ascot Dual Cowl Sport Phaeton.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a The effort comes after Evers&#39; administration had clashed with Republican lawmakers over whether he needed their permission to make such purchases. (Steve Apps/Wisconsin State Journal via AP, File)\n<p class=\"copyright\">Associated Press</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers asked President Donald Trump in a letter to \"reconsider\" his visit to Kenosha, saying he is concerned Trump's \"presence will only hinder our healing.\"</li><li>In a letter sent to the White House Sunday, Evers wrote that he was also concerned that an in-person visit from the president \"will require a massive re-direction\" of resources to support his visit \"at a time when it is critical that we continue to remain focused on keeping the people of Kenosha safe and supporting the community's response.\"</li><li>Last Sunday, a <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/police-kenosha-cop-shot-jacob-blake-rusten-sheskey-2020-8\">Kenosha police officer</a> shot Blake, a 29-year-old Black man, several times in the back after officers initially responded to what the department described as a&#160;<a href=\"https://twitter.com/KenoshaPolice/status/1297705233322258438\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\">\"domestic incident.\"</a></li><li>A graphic video of the incident went viral, sparking statewide protests. Evers activated the National Guard in response on Monday.</li><li>In a statement to Business Insider, White House deputy press secretary Judd Deere said Trump \"looks forward to visiting on Tuesday and helping this great city heal and rebuild.\"</li><li>\"The White House has been humbled by the outreach of individuals from Kenosha who have welcomed the President's visit and are longing for leadership to support local law enforcement and businesses that have been vandalized,\" Deere said in the statement.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers wrote to President Donald Trump asking him to \"reconsider\" his decision to visit Kenosha amid protests sparked by the police shooting of Jacob Blake last week.</p><p>In a letter sent to the White House Sunday, Evers asked Trump to reconsider his Kenosha visit, writing that he and \"other community leaders\" are concerned about what the president's \"presence will mean for Kenosha and our state.\"</p><p>\"I am concerned your presence will only hinder our healing,\" Evers wrote. \"I am concerned your presence will only delay our work to overcome division and move forward together.\"</p><p>He added he is also concerned that an in-person visit from the president \"will require a massive re-direction\" of resources to support his visit \"at a time when it is critical that we continue to remain focused on keeping the people of Kenosha safe and supporting the community's response.\"</p><p>Last Sunday, a <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/police-kenosha-cop-shot-jacob-blake-rusten-sheskey-2020-8\">Kenosha police officer</a> shot Blake, a 29-year-old Black man, several times in the back after officers initially responded to what the department described as a&#160;<a href=\"https://twitter.com/KenoshaPolice/status/1297705233322258438\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\">\"domestic incident.\"</a> Blake is in stable condition in the ICU, and his&#160;<a href=\"https://www.insider.com/jacob-blake-paralyzed-waist-down-father-says-shooting-2020-8\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\">family and attorney said he is paralyzed from the waist down</a>.</p><p>A graphic video of the incident went viral, sparking statewide protests. Evers activated the National Guard in response on Monday.</p><p>The following day, <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/kyle-rittenhouse-who-shot-kenosha-protesters-was-obsessed-with-cops-2020-8\">Kyle Rittenhouse</a>, a 17-year-old from Antioch, Illinois, arrived to the Kenosha protests armed with an AR-15. Rittenhouse <a href=\"https://dailycaller.com/2020/08/26/alleged-kenosha-shooter-he-help-people-protect-property-before-shooting/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\">told a reporter for The Daily Caller</a> earlier that he was there to <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/kenosha-gunman-kyle-rittenhouse-interview-2020-8\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\">protect local businesses</a> from looting. The Illinois teenager is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/kenosha-kyle-rittenhouse-charged-with-first-degree-homicide-2020-8\">charged with first-degree homicide</a> in connection with the killings of two protesters and injuring of a third.</p><p>\"Kenosha and communities across Wisconsin are enduring extraordinary grief, grappling with a Black man being shot seven times and the loss of two additional lives Tuesday night at the hands of an out-of-state armed militant,\" Evers wrote in the letter to Trump.</p><p>\"It is our job as elected officials to lead by example and to be a calming presence for the people we know are hurting, mourning, and trying to cope with trauma,\" he continued. \"Now is not the time for divisiveness. Now is not the time for elected officials to ignore armed militants and out-of-state agitators who want to contribute to our anguish.\"</p><p>In a statement to Business Insider, White House deputy press secretary Judd Deere said Trump \"looks forward to visiting on Tuesday and helping this great city heal and rebuild.\"</p><p>\"The White House has been humbled by the outreach of individuals from Kenosha who have welcomed the President's visit and are longing for leadership to support local law enforcement and businesses that have been vandalized,\" Deere said in the statement.</p><p>Representatives from Evers' office did not immediately respond to Business Insider's request for comment.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" 6},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"One person has been shot dead in Portland as clashes break out between pro-Trump supporters and Black Lives Matter protesters","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/one-shot-dead-in-portland-trump-supporters-blm-protesters-clash-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4b6d4a7ffa48002894d0ae?format=jpeg\" alt=\"portlsnd homicide police cordon patriot prayer\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Portland police officer ties a police line around the scene of a fatal shooting near a pro-Trump rally on August 29, 2020 in Portland, Oregon.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nathan Howard/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>A man was fatally shot in Portland on Saturday, on a night of confrontation between pro-Trump and Black Lives Matter supporters, according to multiple reports.&#160;</li><li>Portland Police, <a href=\"https://www.portlandoregon.gov/police/news/read.cfm?id=261150&ec=1&ch=twitter=twitter\">who have opened a homicide investigation</a>, has not confirmed whether the shooting was connected to the protests.&#160;</li><li>Images of a man being treated for an apparent gunshot wound in Portland show a man in a Patriot Prayer hat. Police have not confirmed the identity of the shooting victim.</li><li>Patriot Prayer is a Portland-based pro-Trump group with far-right connections.&#160;</li><li>A caravan of around 600 vehicles had arrived to express support for President Donald Trump, <a href=\"https://apnews.com/9193c733a02ab33304b32e1c27ce7d55?utm_campaign=SocialFlow&utm_medium=AP&utm_source=Twitter=Twitter\">according to the Associated Press (AP)</a>.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>A man was shot and killed in Portland on Saturday evening, as protesters and counter-protesters clashed, according to multiple reports.&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.portlandoregon.gov/police/news/read.cfm?id=261153&ec=1&ch=twitter=twitter\">Portland Police have opened a homicide investigation</a>. In a statement, the police did not say whether the shooting was connected to the confrontations downtown that evening between a large caravan of Trump supporters arriving in the city and Black Lives Matter protesters.&#160;</p><p>The identity of the man who was killed has not been confirmed. However, a photographer working on assignment <a href=\"https://apnews.com/9193c733a02ab33304b32e1c27ce7d55?utm_campaign=SocialFlow&utm_medium=AP&utm_source=Twitter=Twitter\">for the Associated Press (AP)</a> said the victim was wearing a hat with the insignia of Patriot Prayer, a Portland-based pro-Trump group with far-right connections.&#160;</p><p>A Getty Images photograph from the protests also shows police treating a man, apparently white, at the scene in a Patriot Prayer hat. The block around the scene of the shooting has been cordoned off.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4b703860bf1f002807961d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"portland protests shooting patriot prayer\" height=\"999\" width=\"1999\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A man is treated by medics after being shot during a confrontation on Saturday, Aug. 29, 2020, in Portland, Ore.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Paula Bronstein/AP Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"Portland Police officers heard sounds of gunfire from the area of Southeast 3rd Avenue and Southwest Alder Street,\" read the police statement. \"They responded and located a victim with a gunshot wound to the chest. Medical responded and determined that the victim was deceased.\"</p><p>During the day, a rally of around 600 vehicles in support of President Donald Trump had arrived in the city, according to the AP.</p><p>In the early hours of Sunday morning, police tweeted that there had been some clashes between the Trump supporters and the Portland protesters.&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Portland Police  (@PortlandPolice) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1299909125816512515?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>The shooting took place after most of the pro-Trump caravan had left downtown, <a href=\"https://www.oregonlive.com/portland/2020/08/1-person-shot-killed-near-downtown-portland-protests-saturday.html\">according to local newspaper The Oregonian</a>. Organizers of the rally had encouraged the Patriot Prayer protesters to arrive armed, but not to wear weapons openly, the paper reported.</p><p>This is the third consecutive weekend that has seen clashes between competing groups, according to the paper.</p><p>Portland has seen continual protests from Black Lives Matter supporters since the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/protests-death-george-floyd-minneapolis-new-york-denver-2020-5#protests-began-in-minneapolis-on-tuesday-and-escalated-and-spread-across-the-country-from-wednesday-2\">police killing of Black man George Floyd in late May</a>.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4c0d517ffa48002894d125?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Sheriff Todd Wright sits in the corner of the Arkansas County Courthouse as officials and community members ask him to resign.\" height=\"1594\" width=\"2872\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sheriff Todd Wright sits in the corner of the Arkansas County Courthouse as officials and community members ask him to resign.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/watch/live/?v=328349198366909&#38;ref=watch_permalink\" target=\"_blank\">Facebook</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Desiree Middlebrooks secretly recorded the father of her children, Arkansas County Sheriff Todd Wright, going on a racist rant about a Black employee she talked to.&#160;</li><li>During a court meeting Friday, community members pleaded for Wright to resign, but he resisted.&#160;</li><li>After his colleague told Wright to \"lay that badge down, lay that gun down and walk out of here,\" Wright did just that.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Arkansas County Sheriff Todd Wright resigned Friday months after a recording revealed him going on a racist rant about a Black grocery store employee.&#160;</p><p>In the five-minute recording, captured secretly by the mother of his children Desiree Middlebrooks and shared widely on social media, a man later identified as Wright is heard using a racial slur nine times.&#160;</p><p>Wright was apparently <a href=\"https://www.pbcommercial.com/news/20200827/arkansas-county-judge-responds-to-leaked-audio\">upset that Middlebrooks talked to the employee</a>. He called her a \"n----- lover,\" later saying, \"Why you got to holler at f------ n----- when I'm around?\"&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.pbcommercial.com/news/20200827/arkansas-county-judge-responds-to-leaked-audio\">In a May 28 Facebook post reported by the Pine Bluff Commerical</a>, Wright acknowledged it was his voice, saying, \"To all I have offended or hurt I send my sincere apologies and will pray for my enemies.\"&#160;</p><p>But that wasn't enough. <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/08/30/arkansas-county-sheriff-todd-wright-resigns-after-leaked-racist-rant/5673985002/\">On Friday, a special meeting was held at the Arkansas County Courthouse</a> in which the Arkansas County Quorum Court unanimously requested that Wright resign.&#160;</p><p>The court didn't have the authority to fire him, Arkansas County Judge Eddie Best said, <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/08/30/arkansas-county-sheriff-todd-wright-resigns-after-leaked-racist-rant/5673985002/\">according to USA Today</a>.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Throughout the several-hour hearing, <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/watch/live/?v=328349198366909&ref=watch_permalinklink\">broadcast on Facebook</a>, public officials, community members, activists, and at least one colleague urge Wright to resign.&#160;</p><p>\"After viewing and hearing the video I was terribly upset to know that we have someone out here that's supposed to be taking care of us, protecting and serving to have that kind of opinion of me &#8211; I'm using me as a race because of my color,\" Justice of the Peace Inez McLemore said.&#160;</p><p>Wright blamed his behavior on the devil, insisted he's not racist, and pointed to some of the Black community members he said he has good relationships with.&#160;</p><p>\"I'm a Christian man. I read my Bible every day,\" Wright said. \"I am by no means a racist. That video does not show the true picture of me.\"</p><p>But the crowd, including a woman who said she's the aunt of the Black employee, didn't buy it.</p><p>\"I don't believe anything you just said,\" she said. \"You have to say this stuff because you want to keep your job.\"&#160;</p><p>Wright at first refused to resign, then said he would do so in a month, and finally did what the crowd requested &#8212; said he'd resign immediately &#8212; after his former colleague spoke.&#160;</p><p>\"Todd, I've known you all my life. You need to take that badge and (set) it on that table and walk out of here Todd,\" former officer Bobby Webb said. \"You know I love you, but you screwed up. Lay that badge down, lay that gun down and walk out of here.\"</p><p>The court passed a motion allowing Wright to receive payment as a contract labor, but not active law enforcement, for the next month, <a href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/arkansas-sheriff-resigns-over-racist-rant-leaked-recording-n1238791\">NBC News reported</a>. Until a replacement is found, the county's chief deputy will fill in for Wright's spot.&#160;</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/kenosha-race-relations-jacob-blake-police-kyle-rittenhouse-shootings-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Kenosha residents say the way police handled the 2 shootings this week tell you all you need to know about whether the city is racist</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/racist-jokes-microaggressions-and-tokenism-in-the-influencer-world-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">Stories of racist jokes, microaggressions, and tokenism from YouTubers highlight a widespread problem within the influencer industry</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/new-york-couple-charged-racially-harassing-black-neighbor-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">A New York couple was charged with harassment after their Black neighbor said they threw feces and planted 'dead squirrels' on her property</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/karen-viral-video-california-father-white-woman-n-word-parking-2020-8\" data-read-more-link=\"\" data-e2e-name=\"read-more-link\">A father filmed a racist encounter with a white woman who called him the N-word and phoned the police over a parking spot</a></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a
