14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Trump pardoned Alice Marie Johnson, his former clemency recipient who spoke highly of him at the RNC","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-pardons-alice-johnson-who-praised-him-in-rnc-speech-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4bab0c7ffa48002894d0cc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"alice johnson\" height=\"3950\" width=\"5266\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>U.S. President Donald Trump signs a document as Alice Johnson looks on during an event in the Oval Office of the White House August 28, 2020 in Washington, DC.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Anna Moneymaker/Pool/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>President Donald Trump on Friday pardoned Alice Marie Johnson, the 63-year-old grandmother who was serving a life sentence for non-violent drug offenses.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alice-johnson-trump-clemency-pardon-kim-kardashian-west-2018-5\">Trump granted Johnson clemency</a> in 2018, with the help of Kim Kardashian West who championed for her early release from Aliceville correctional facility in Alabama.&#160;&#160;</li><li>Johnson spoke at the Republican National Convention praising her freedom, \"by the grace of God and the compassion of President Donald John Trump.\"</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>WASHINGTON (AP) &#8212; President Donald Trump pardoned a woman on Friday who had praised him the night before at the Republican National Convention.</p><p>Trump pardoned Alice Marie Johnson, who had spent more than two decades serving life without parole for a nonviolent drug offense. She had been convicted in 1996 on eight criminal counts related to a Memphis-based cocaine trafficking operation.</p><p>Trump had commuted her life sentence in federal prison in 2018, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/alice-johnson-trump-clemency-pardon-kim-kardashian-west-2018-5\">with the backing of Kim Kardashian West</a>, which allowed her early release.</p><p>\"Ms. Johnson has accepted responsibility for her past behavior and has been a model prisoner over the past two decades. Despite receiving a life sentence, Alice worked hard to rehabilitate herself in prison, and act as a mentor to her fellow inmates,\" the White House said in a 2018 statement.&#160;</p><p>Unlike a pardon, the commutation did not erase Johnson's conviction &#8212; it only ended her sentence.</p><p>Since her release, Johnson has used her platform to help other non-violent offenders to get released from prison &#8212; <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/investigations/trump-freed-alice-johnson-in-2018-this-week-he-granted-clemency-to-three-of-her-friends/2020/02/19/1ea710be-5327-11ea-87b2-101dc5477dd7_story.html\">helping three of her friends receive clemency earlier this year.&#160;</a></p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Kim Kardashian West  (@KimKardashian) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1235229349474979842?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">March 4, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>Trump said Johnson had done an \"incredible job\" since her release, identifying additional prisoners who could be eligible for early release. \"We're giving Alice a full pardon,\" Trump said on Friday.&#160;</p><p>\"We're very proud of Alice,\" he <a href=\"https://www.c-span.org/video/?475286-1/president-trump-grants-alice-johnson-full-pardon#\">added</a>.&#160;</p><p>Johnson had spoken at the convention about the power of redemption and praised Trump. Trump has sought to highlight criminal justice reform leading up to November's election as he reaches out to African American voters.</p><p>She said Thursday that she was free \"by the grace of God and the compassion of President Donald John Trump.\"</p><p>Business Insider's Taylor contributed to this reporting.&#160;</p><p><strong>Read more:&#160;</strong></p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/university-of-alabama-professors-tell-students-covid-19-infected-2020-8\" data-analytics-position=\"3\" data-analytics-module=\"featured_post\">University of Alabama told professors to not tell students about COVID-19 cases among their classmates</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/tweet-announcing-chadwick-bosemans-death-becomes-most-liked-2020-8\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"featured_post\">Chadwick Boseman's last tweet has become the most-liked of all time, Twitter confirms</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/mlks-granddaughter-calls-for-genuine-equality-in-speech-2020-8\" data-analytics-position=\"9\" data-analytics-module=\"featured_post\">MLK's 12-year-old granddaughter called for 'genuine equality' on the anniversary of the 'I Have a Dream' speech</a></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/NDZfkOSxxZM\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 30 Aug 2020 19:29:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4bab0c7ffa48002894d0cc?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"f24bbbed0b53c7f11d8ae40dc55a98de","destWidth":5266,"destHeight":3950,"sourceBytes":2807888,"destBytes":2807888,"author":"insider@insider.com (Kevin Freking)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4bab0c7ffa48002894d0cc?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=NDZfkOSxxZM:CzVxiTUSInU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn45@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-01-02-069_3cb87878a79dc825.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=NDZfkOSxxZM:CzVxiTUSInU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/NDZfkOSxxZM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn26@2020_5/2020/08/31/06-00-56-931_3442745b9a1cb33b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650322},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"5 Steven Spielberg movies inspired by his dad's service in World War II","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/steven-spielberg-movies-inspired-by-his-dads-wwii-service-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4949cd7ffa48002894ce96?format=jpeg\" alt=\"steven spielberg\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Steven Spielberg at the Foundation for the National Archives 2013 Records of Achievement award ceremony honoring the director.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Michael Loccisano/Getty Images for Foundation for the National Archives</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Arnold Spielberg, a World War II veteran and father of acclaimed director Steven Spielberg, died this week at 103.</li><li>Arnold's experiences were a major influence on his son's films, some of which were inspired by his wartime service.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>Steven Spielberg's father served in World War II and the director's dad has been a major influence on the director's career. Arnold Spielberg died this week at 103, so let's take a look at how he inspired his son to make some of the greatest films and TV shows about the greatest generation.</p><p>Like many young men of his generation, Arnold Spielberg enlisted in the <a href=\"http://www.military.com/army\">Army</a> within a month of the December 7, 1941, Japanese attack on <a href=\"http://www.military.com/base-guide/naval-station-pearl-harbor\">Pearl Harbor</a>.</p><p>He served as a radio operator and chief communications man for the 490th Bomb Squadron, nicknamed the \"Burma Bridge Busters\" after their assigned mission to bomb Japanese bridges and railroad lines. Spielberg volunteered for two combat tours in the China Burma India theater of war.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f494b7d60bf1f002807942d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Steven Spielberg and Arnold Spielberg\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Steven Spielberg and Arnold Spielberg in Beverly Hills, California, April 26, 2012.\n<p class=\"copyright\">FilmMagic via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Arnold married Leah Posner after his return home and son Steven was born in 1946 at the beginning of the post-war baby boom. He developed a fascination with gadgets during his military service and got an engineering degree from the University of Cincinnati on the G.I. Bill.</p><p>That led to a career in the new field of computer science that included stints working for RCA, GE, Electronic Arrays, SDS, Burroughs and IBM.</p><p>Steven credits his dad for his own devotion to new technology. \"When I see a PlayStation, when I look at a cell phone &#8212; from the smallest calculator to an iPad &#8212; I look at my dad and I say, 'My dad and a team of geniuses started that.'\"</p><p>Arnold Spielberg also supported his only son's devotion to movies, giving him access to gear and helping his teenage son make his first films with a home movie camera. The 1961 short \"Fighter Squad\" was shot at the Sky Harbor Airport hangar in Phoenix and featured grounded former WWII fighter planes.</p><p>Here are five World War II movies from a storied career, movies that would never have been made without the influence and early support of Arnold Spielberg.</p><h2>1. 'Saving Private Ryan'</h2><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/9CiW_DgxCnQ\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>\"Saving Private Ryan,\" released in 1998, refocused American minds on the heroes of World War II and kicked off two decades of tribute to the men and women who won the war.</p><p>Capt. John Miller (Tom Hanks) leads his men behind German lines to rescue a missing soldier and teaches everyone the importance of shared sacrifice. The 20-minute opening sequence recreates the Allied Forces' D-Day landing on Omaha Beach and stands as the greatest battle sequence in movie history.</p><p>\"Saving Private Ryan\" is currently available to stream on HBO Max and on 4K UHD, Blu-ray, DVD and Digital.</p><h2>2. '1941'</h2><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/6_KOLqpo7z8\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>\"1941,\" released in 1979, lampoons the panic in Los Angeles about a rumored Japanese invasion in the days immediately after Pearl Harbor. American wasn't exactly ready for a World War II farce back then and the movie has a reputation as one of Spielberg's rare failures.</p><p>Seen 40 years later, the movie plays as a cross between \"Animal House\" and \"It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World,\" bringing together young comedy talent like John Belushi, Dan Aykroyd and John Candy alongside Hollywood legends like Robert Stack, Christopher Lee, Warren Oates and Slim Pickens. It's flawed but still very funny.</p><p>\"1941\" is currently available on Blu-ray, DVD and Digital.</p><h2>3. 'Schindler's List'</h2><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/gG22XNhtnoY\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>\"Schindler's List,\" released in 1993, won seven Oscars, including Best Picture and Spielberg's first Best Director Oscar. More importantly, it told the story of the Holocaust for a mainstream audience by focusing on one of the few heroes from that terrifying chapter of World War II history.</p><p>Oskar Schindler was a German industrialist who protected his Jewish employees from Nazi extermination by employing him in his factories. The real-life Schindler is credited with saving 1,200 lives during the war.</p><p>Spielberg's family is Jewish and the movie is just as much about the lives lost as the lives saved. It's shot in black-and-white and effectively conveys the horror and the sadness while chronicling the heroism of a man who chose to resist the Nazi regime.</p><p>\"Schindler's List\" is currently available to stream on Netflix and on 4K UHD, Blu-ray, DVD and Digital.</p><h2>4. 'Empire of the Sun'</h2><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/i_WiDVA1kLY\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>\"Empire of the Sun,\" released in 1987, features a 12-year-old Christain Bale in a movie based on J.G. Ballard's novel about a young English boy living in Shanghai, China after the Japanese invasion. Separated from his family, he's forced to grow up to survive over the course of the war.</p><p>The movie was originally set to be directed by the great David Lean and produced by Spielberg. Lean won Oscars for directing \"The Bridge on the River Kwai\" and \"Lawrence of Arabia.\" Both movies also won Best Picture and stand among the greatest war pictures ever made. Spielberg considers Lean a major influence on his filmmaking and aimed to make the same kind of epic once Lean dropped out of the movie.</p><p>\"Empire of the Sun\" is currently available to stream on HBO Max and on Blu-ray, DVD and Digital.</p><h2>5. 'Escape to Nowhere'</h2><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/pI3431fetiM\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>Let's hope the 1961 \"Escape to Nowhere\" is safely stored in the Spielberg family archives and will be available for aspiring filmmakers to study someday. For now, we've only got the blurry (but still impressive) excerpt that's available on YouTube.</p><p>The clip that exists shows that young Steven was already learning how to shoot and edit a scene. Are <a href=\"http://www.military.com/join-armed-forces/military-uniforms/uniform-and-insignia-guide.html\">uniforms</a> wrong? Are the production values non-existent? Sure, but what were you doing when you were 15?</p><p>This list doesn't include the Spielberg productions of \"Band of Brothers\" (2001) and \"The Pacific\" (2010). Each epic HBO series took its inspiration from the camaraderie on display in \"Saving Private Ryan\" and told more stories collected by historian Stephen Ambrose. Both shows are streaming on HBO Max and available on Blu-ray, DVD and Digital.</p><p>Spielberg and Apple TV+ are making yet another World War II series called \"Masters of the Air\" and have yet to announce a release date.</p><p>Spielberg also produced the outstanding Netflix documentary \"Five Came Back,\" based on Mark Harris' book about five of Hollywood's most legendary directors and their service in World War II.</p><p>Arnold Spielberg may have had the most influence on \"The Mission,\" a 1985 episode of the original \"Amazing Stories\" television series personally directed by Steven. Kevin Costner and Kiefer Sutherland star in this show about a WWII tail gunner trapped in the belly of a B-17. You can stream this episode in the NBC app or on <a href=\"https://www.nbc.com/amazing-stories/video/the-mission/2909096\">NBC.com</a>. The \"Amazing Stories\" series is available on DVD and digital.</p><p>Finally, don't forget the Nazi bad guys in \"Raiders of the Lost Ark\" (1981) and \"Indiana Jones and Last Crusade\" (1989). Some people want to count them as World World II movies, but even we're willing to admit that's a stretch. Both are streaming on Netflix and both are available on Blu-ray, DVD and Digital.</p><p>The legacy of Arnold Spielberg offers a great lesson for parents. Support your kids. Encourage their creativity and provide them with whatever gear you can. Raise them right. They might not become one of Hollywood's greatest directors but they'll make you proud some other way.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Barber)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4949cd7ffa48002894ce96?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn73@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-54-211_de9848dea48e0623.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f494b7d60bf1f002807942d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn6@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-00-55-061_b70fed5544ef0ba1.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=l-7AM5KKJhE:f3EvCzn-87A:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn78@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-53-615_392e8049bb650987.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=l-7AM5KKJhE:f3EvCzn-87A:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-55-984_1c3161b574dd036c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/l-7AM5KKJhE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn62@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-00-57-869_4938a82ae4c2f12d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650330},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Counter-protester who pulled a gun on Black Lives Matter protesters in Florida after a fight erupted won't be charged","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/counter-protester-not-charged-after-pulling-gun-on-protesters-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4c043e7ffa48002894d117?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Florida\" height=\"3600\" width=\"4800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Don Juan Moore / Contributor/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>A counter-protester in Tallahassee pulled a gun on Black Lives Matter protesters yesterday after a fight erupted.</li><li>The man will not be charged, as the city found the counter-protester was \"lawfully defending himself.\"</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>The police shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha, Wisconsin has sparked protests around the country.</p><p>Yesterday, in front of the <a href=\"https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/2020/08/30/tallahassee-police-no-charges-after-gun-pulled-during-protest/5674055002/\">Florida Historic Capitol building</a>, a counter-protester pulled a gun on Black Live Matter protesters after getting knocked to the ground.</p><p>After reviewing the incident, <a href=\"https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/2020/08/30/tallahassee-police-no-charges-after-gun-pulled-during-protest/5674055002/\">The City of Tallahassee has confirmed that the individual, whose identity has not been released, will not face charges.</a></p><p>As the <a href=\"https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/2020/08/30/tallahassee-police-no-charges-after-gun-pulled-during-protest/5674055002/\">Tallahassee Democrat</a> reported, the city stated in a press release that the individual had a license to carry a concealed weapon. The city also pointed out that the protest was not permitted, and protesters did not coordinate with the police department ahead of time to coordinate and ensure safety.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Tallahassee Democrat  (@TDOnline) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300112333734379520?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>\"The evidence confirmed the physical altercation between numerous protesters and that the individual was knocked to the ground and under attack before lawfully defending himself,\" <a href=\"https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/2020/08/30/tallahassee-police-no-charges-after-gun-pulled-during-protest/5674055002/\">the press release states</a>.</p><p>According to the Tallahassee Democrat, the city found that the incident transpired after a white man was pushed by a white protester for documenting the protest, thus sparking a fight. As the counter-protester got up from the ground, he drew his weapon.</p><p>As seen on the video, the man was quickly unarmed by police. No injuries were reported.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/4JYbyWVOQY4\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 30 Aug 2020 20:20:20 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4c044960bf1f002807966f?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"2896360b05c368e10a32ff699c3e33fe","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn56@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-52-706_88a10b8d4338a534.webp","destWidth":4800,"destHeight":3600,"sourceBytes":1272972,"destBytes":1272972,"author":"insider@insider.com (Libertina Brandt)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4c043e7ffa48002894d117?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn74@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-02-497_4e460bfbde75f565.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=4JYbyWVOQY4:GupqIXZaDgI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn41@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-01-02-125_0642eceea7bad689.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=4JYbyWVOQY4:GupqIXZaDgI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn83@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-01-00-917_8d9fbdaac0fe49d9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/4JYbyWVOQY4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn41@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-00-58-324_1dbbe260f4f98824.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650322},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"As Trump shakes up the military footprint in Europe, the US and Russia are making moves in the high north","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-russia-arctic-activity-amid-us-changes-europe-military-presence-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4a9c307ffa48002894d079?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Navy submarine Seawolf Norway\" height=\"800\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US Navy Seawolf-class fast attack sub USS Seawolf off the coast of Tromso, Norway, August 21, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Navy</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Recent US military operations around Norway underscore that country's strategic value for NATO as geopolitical competition grows in the Arctic.</li><li>Those events, and that growing competition, come as the Trump administration rearranges the US military presence in Europe.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>US military activity around Norway this month reflects the continuing strategic value of NATO's northernmost member, even as the Trump administration changes the US footprint there and across Europe.</p><p>The US and Norwegian militaries <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/marine-corps-force-redesign-means-taking-tanks-from-norway-caves-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">have longstanding ties</a>, but military <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nato-exercise-dynamic-mongoose-practices-anti-submarine-warfare-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">activity in the area has increased</a> as the region grows more accessible and tensions with Russia remain high. Mid-August saw a flurry of such activity by the US.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4a9c4b60bf1f00280795ef?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Navy destroyer Roosevelt Norway\" height=\"1874\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Sailors on the fo&#39;c&#39;sle of US Navy guided-missile destroyer USS Roosevelt as it pulls into Tromsø, Norway, August 17, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Navy/MCS Seaman Austin G. Collins</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On August 17, guided-missile destroyer USS Roosevelt stopped in Troms&#248; in northern Norway after a 50-day patrol in the high north, where the Roosevelt and other US ships \"have received steadfast support from Norway,\" the Navy said.</p><p>On August 21, the West Coast-based attack submarine USS Seawolf made a brief stop near Troms&#248; after traveling across the planet to operate around Europe.</p><p>The Navy rarely announces the whereabouts of its subs &#8212; especially one of the sophisticated Seawolf class, <a href=\"https://fas.org/man/dod-101/sys/ship/ssn-21.htm\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">designed to take on</a> the Soviets &#8212; indicating this was likely meant as a message.</p><p>\"The arrival of Seawolf compliments our already robust undersea warfare capabilities and demonstrates our continued commitment to providing maritime security and deterrence throughout the region,\" Rear Adm. Anthony Carullo, commander of the Naples-based Submarine Group 8, said in a release.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4a9bdb7ffa48002894d077?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Norway F-16 Air Force B-52\" height=\"675\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Norwegian F-16s train with US Air Force B-52s, August 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Norwegian Armed Forces</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The action wasn't limited to the sea. Norwegian fighter jets trained with US Air Force B-52 bombers before the bombers' August 22 arrival in the UK for a bomber task force rotation.</p><p>\"Training outside the US enables aircrew and airmen to become familiar with other theaters and airspace\" and to build on existing skills and relationships, an Air Force spokesperson said in an email.</p><p>Flight trackers appeared to <a href=\"https://twitter.com/nukestrat/status/1297538866589642752/photo/3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">show the bombers</a> flying north from North Dakota, traveling over Greenland and through the Arctic before approaching the UK over the Norwegian Sea. The Air Force spokesperson declined to comment on the bombers' route, citing operational security.</p><h2>'We are wherever we want'</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4aa9f97ffa48002894d082?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Norway Norwegian soldiers Arctic Russia\" height=\"1666\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Norwegian soldiers patrol on Norway&#39;s side of the border with Russia, in Finnmark county, Norway, October 23, 2019.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>As Russian military capabilities in the Arctic eroded after the Cold War, NATO's focus on the region \"rapidly faded,\" said Heather Conley, senior vice president for Europe, Eurasia, and the Arctic at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.</p><p>Interest in the Arctic has grown recently <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/record-heat-in-the-arctic-is-affecting-ice-cover-fisheries-2020-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">as it becomes more accessible</a>. Russia has refocused on the region as an economic and military imperative \"for well over the past decade,\" Conley said. \"The US and NATO have only recently arrived at the rediscovery phase about two years ago.\"</p><p>Russia, which has the world's longest Arctic coastline, has been <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/russia-nato-increasing-military-activity-in-the-arctic-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">refurbishing military facilities there</a> and conducting more exercises.</p><p>The US has \"grown steadily concerned\" about Russia's moves, particularly <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nato-exercise-dynamic-mongoose-practices-anti-submarine-warfare-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">its submarine activity</a> in the North Atlantic as well as flights farther south by its long-range bombers, Conley said. The US has increased its Arctic activity, including <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-navy-surface-ships-sail-into-barents-sea-near-russia-2020-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">military exercises not done since the Cold War</a>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d499d2a100a2426fa645814?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Russia submarine Arctic\" height=\"921\" width=\"1400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Russian submarine K-560 Severodvinsk.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Russian Ministry of Defense</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>With the recent activity around Norway, \"the US is signaling, with its NATO partners, that it will deter and defend NATO's northern flank and the North Atlantic,\" Conley said.</p><p>Actions by one side in one part of the Arctic are often matched by the other in another part. Conley pointed to a recent Russian military exercise near Alaska as context for events around Norway.</p><p>A Russian sub that surfaced during those drills was \"a signal\" that \"we are wherever we want,\" a former Russian navy chief of staff <a href=\"https://apnews.com/1f6c6dceba65e893aeeee9dfa814ef8f\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">told</a> Russian state media.</p><p>There is uncertainty on both sides <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/russia-nato-increasing-military-activity-in-the-arctic-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">about the other's intentions in the Arctic</a>, and a proper forum is \"urgently\" needed to provide transparency for increasing military activity there, Conley said.</p><h2>NATO's eyes and ears</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4aa8427ffa48002894d080?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Marine Corps Marines Norway\" height=\"1667\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>US Marine 1st Lt. Aidan Frombach during cold-weather training in Porsangmoen, Norway, February 20, 2017.\n<p class=\"copyright\">US Marine Corps/Lance Cpl. Victoria Ross</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The increase in US activity in Europe's high north comes as the US revises its military footprint around the continent.</p><p>In July, top US defense officials announced that thousands of US troops stationed in Germany would return home or move elsewhere in Europe, saying the moves improved operational efficiency and positioning.</p><p>Critics argued the changes didn't necessarily improve readiness and pointed instead to President Donald Trump's disdain for Germany as a motive, which <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-defense-officials-detail-plans-to-withdraw-troops-from-germany-2020-7\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Trump himself basically confirmed</a> hours later.</p><p>The US Marine Corps also said this month that it was <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/marine-corps-force-redesign-means-taking-tanks-from-norway-caves-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">adjusting its presence in Norway</a>, ending the back-to-back rotations of several hundred Marines that it has conducted since 2017 and shifting to an \"episodic\" presence aligned with military exercises there.</p><p>The risk of a conflict starting in the high north is still considered low, but Norway and its neighbors have noted increasing Russian military activity, particularly its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nordic-countries-monitor-surge-in-missile-testing-by-russia-2019-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tests of new weapons</a>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d499b32100a247d1f4b0f63?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Norway soldiers troops Arctic air defense missile\" height=\"933\" width=\"1400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Norwegian soldiers load missiles into a NASAMS air-defense system launcher during winter exercise Joint Viking 2017 in Finnmark, Norway, March 2017.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Norwegian Ministry of Defense</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"As a close neighbor to Russia in the north, Norway is witnessing an increasingly potent Russian military capability,\" Tone Skogen, state secretary at the Norwegian Ministry of Defense, <a href=\"https://www.csis.org/events/online-event-enhancing-security-high-north\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">said at a CSIS event</a> in June.</p><p>Russian exercises have shown \"how Russia is increasingly coming closer to our coasts [and] how they are increasingly farther south,\" Skogen said.</p><p>With those exercises, Skogen added, Russia has been able \"to more or less successfully demonstrate\" an ability to close off the Scandinavian Peninsula to protect its military installations on the nearby Kola Peninsula, where the powerful Northern Fleet is based.</p><p>Though new military capabilities have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/marine-corps-force-redesign-means-taking-tanks-from-norway-caves-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">changed what a conflict with Russia might look like in Norway</a>, the Nordic country remains strategically important.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\"Norway has and continues to be vital to the protection of Europe and North America through the 'avenue of approach' from the High North,\" Conley said. \"Norway is NATO's 'sentry' in the North and its eyes and ears to detect Russian military activity near and around the Kola Peninsula and Russia's Northern Fleet.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Woody)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4a9c307ffa48002894d079?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn26@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-02-828_878084d805bc4b00.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4a9c4b60bf1f00280795ef?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5f4a9bdb7ffa48002894d077?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn6@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-55-957_da6943f10394ff77.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4aa9f97ffa48002894d082?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn52@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-01-02-960_e93a81d3621bf840.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d499d2a100a2426fa645814?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn66@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-53-477_d44e597125904c79.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f4aa8427ffa48002894d080?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn68@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-01-946_1759a6a9fd9285e2.webp","https://i.insider.com/5d499b32100a247d1f4b0f63?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-044_b0fbd3047a3636ac.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=AN-cU3aOwIY:fwwmO-Y1Y1Q:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn42@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-54-767_e8b31cc437cc0d5b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=AN-cU3aOwIY:fwwmO-Y1Y1Q:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn58@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-01-00-709_b95a62694e2b4139.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/AN-cU3aOwIY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn33@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-583_56aabcaf9f7d0d28.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650320},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Over two dozen people died after a restaurant suddenly collapsed during a birthday celebration in China","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/restaurant-in-northern-china-collapse-during-birthday-party-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4beaff60bf1f002807965d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"china collaspe\" height=\"2591\" width=\"3888\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In this aerial photo released by Xinhua News Agency, rescue workers are seen near the site of a collapsed two-story restaurant in Xiangfen County of Linfen City, northern China&#39;s Shanxi Province, Saturday, Aug. 29, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yang Chenguang/Xinhua via AP</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Twenty-nine people died in northern China after a restaurant suddenly collapsed during a birthday party on Saturday, local authorities said.&#160;</li><li>An additional 28 people were injured, according to the Ministry of Emergency Management.</li><li>An investigation will be launched to uncover the cause of the incident.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>BEIJING (AP) &#8212; Rescue efforts ended at a two-story restaurant in a northern Chinese village that collapsed during a local resident's 80th birthday celebration, leaving 29 people dead, authorities said Sunday.</p><p>The Ministry of Emergency Management said another 28 people were injured &#8212; seven of them seriously &#8212; when the building suddenly crumbled on Saturday.</p><p>There was no immediate word on what caused the collapse or on the fate of the birthday guest and other celebrants.</p><p>Hundreds of rescue workers using dogs, cranes, and high-tech sensors to search the rubble, lifting slabs of concrete in hopes of freeing survivors.</p><p>The official China Daily newspaper said the building collapsed at 9:40 a.m. Saturday. It said the Cabinet's Work Safety Commission would oversee the investigation into the accident's cause.</p><p>While China has seen major improvements in industrial safety, building standards are sometimes ignored, particularly in rural areas such as Shanxi province's Xiangfen county, about 630 kilometers (400 miles) southwest of Beijing, where the restaurant was located.</p><p>The region lies in the heart of China's coal country, where thousands of miners have died in explosions, collapses and floods over the years.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/restaurant-in-northern-china-collapse-during-birthday-party-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/Dj9z3k8O1Xk\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 30 Aug 2020 20:35:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4bf8ad7ffa48002894d103?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"8983a567c785a787cb37c2a2775dd1cc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn40@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-52-376_69a61b3056c4222d.webp","destWidth":3457,"destHeight":2591,"sourceBytes":1063718,"destBytes":1063718,"author":"insider@insider.com (Insider Inc.)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4beaff60bf1f002807965d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn86@2020_4/2020/08/31/06-00-59-545_3475e739f08c6a50.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=Dj9z3k8O1Xk:QNfvZWW5Txw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-56-921_a3cf6ee374af87b6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=Dj9z3k8O1Xk:QNfvZWW5Txw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn98@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-54-574_4fe021eea8904011.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/Dj9z3k8O1Xk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn12@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-53-692_27628127b8a4042b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650320},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Argan oil can cost as much as $300 per liter. Why is it so expensive?","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-argan-oil-is-so-expensive-morocco-goats-trees-beauty-2020-8","description":"<div style=\"position:relative; overflow:hidden; padding-bottom:56.25%\">\n<iframe src=\"https://cdn.jwplayer.com/players/l973kePd-jZbcmOYf.html\"\nwidth=\"100%\" height=\"100%\" frameborder=\"0\" scrolling=\"auto\" title=\"Argan oil can cost as much as $300 per liter. Why is it so expensive?\"\nstyle=\"position:absolute;\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n</div><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><p><strong>In just one generation, the international market for argan oil has risen from 200 liters to 4,000 metric tons.</strong></p></li><li><p><strong>This artisanal oil was originally sold on the roadside in recycled bottles for as little as $3 per liter.</strong></p></li><li><p><strong>It takes one woman approximately 24 hours to produce one liter of argan oil.</strong></p></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p><em>Below is a transcript of the video:</em></p><p>Argan oil can cost as much as $300 per liter, making it the world's most expensive edible oil. Just 20 years ago, however, the production of argan oil was isolated to local villages in Morocco, with international sales virtually nonexistent. But since then, the formation of women-run cooperatives has transformed the production into a billion-dollar industry.</p><p>So, why has argan oil suddenly gained such popularity? And what makes it so expensive?</p><p>Argan oil is predominantly used in high-end cosmetic products and Moroccan cuisine. The oil comes from the seed of the argan tree, native only to the narrow strip of semi-desert between Morocco's Atlantic coast and the Atlas Mountains. The Amazigh people of North Africa have been using the argan seeds for centuries, and the methods for creating this costly oil haven't changed in years.</p><p><strong>Khadija Heeda:</strong> The first stage of production is the collection. We collect the fruits of the argan. We collect them when they are mature. The young fruit is this color, green. We can't collect it by striking the tree with sticks or picking it from the tree. We wait for it to mature and drop to the ground, and its color turns to brown.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Once collected, the argan fruits are sun-dried before being peeled and de-pulped by hand to remove the fleshy outer layers. The leftover argan nut then needs to be cracked to retrieve the oil-rich kernel inside.</p><p><strong>Khadija Heeda:</strong> This is a difficult stage. Not just anybody can crack this nut, because you need to know the technique to crack it correctly to maintain the structure of the nut and not grind it. To obtain a liter of argan oil, we need 40 kilograms of the fruit, or about 20 kilograms of the nuts, to obtain one liter.</p><p><strong> Narrator:</strong> The next stage is grinding, which is often also done by hand.</p><p><strong>Khadija Heeda:</strong> We grind the argan kernels in this traditional method that we learned from our ancestors and that is known in our Moroccan heritage. This is a time-consuming method. To obtain one liter, this method takes two hours. That is why we developed, and now we are able, when we have a large order, to use the machine. The machine &#8212; it takes little time. In five minutes, it can produce one or two liters.</p><p>Argan oil is not like other oils. The best quality is known as \"red gold\" because it is very expensive. Argan oil requires a lot of effort to produce. For one woman to produce one liter of argan oil, it would take her approximately 24 hours.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> The leftover pulp removed from the fruit is sold as animal feed, particularly for goats, who are intrinsically linked to the argan tree. In some areas, it's tradition to allow goats to climb the trees to freely feed on the fruits. Argan kernels are then collected from their excrement, saving the laborious work of cracking open the nuts manually. But nowadays, in most argan forestries, this peculiar sight is mainly used as a tourist attraction.</p><p><strong>Khadija Heeda:</strong> When oil produced that way was studied, it was found to be unfit for consumption. If the goat has any problem, it becomes harmful. Goats are a part of this region &#8212; tourists enjoy seeing the goats in the argan trees, and they like to take pictures with them.</p><p><strong>Narrator</strong>: Traditionally, Amazigh women, who until 1956 required the man's permission to leave their homes, made argan oil primarily for culinary purposes using methods passed down through generations. This artisanal oil was occasionally sold on the roadside in recycled bottles for as little as $3 per liter.</p><p><strong>Zoubida Charrouf:</strong> We found out that the women who prepared this oil in a traditional way had very soft skin and no wrinkles at all. But we had no scientific proof.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Zoubida Charrouf first studied the argan tree for her PhD in the late 1980s, when the species was in dangerous decline. After conducting scientific research to support the moisturizing benefits of argan oil on hair and skin, Charrouf planned to transform the environmental problem into an economic solution.</p><p><strong>Zoubida Charrouf:</strong> The objective was not to keep these results in the drawers at the university, but to go out into the field and organize the sector. These women were not organized at all, who produced argan oil in the traditional way at home. It was very difficult. It was something new. They didn't know what a cooperative was. Then, they never left their homes. But we started with 16 women, and as soon as the others saw how this first cooperative turned out, a lot of women came to see us who also wanted to organize themselves into cooperatives and benefit from the marketing of Argan oil.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> Sure enough, the rapid rise in popularity of argan oil not only brought profit to the region, but also revitalized an entire ecosystem. The newfound respect for the value of argan trees ensured stability for the species, and in turn, the surrounding wildlife and community reaped the benefits. The argan tree, known locally as \"the tree of life,\" provides food, shelter, and protection from desertification, and its deep roots prevent soil erosion, allowing vegetated grass to grow for grazing livestock. It's estimated that up to 90% of the economy in this region is owed to the argan tree.</p><p><strong>Zoubida Charrouf:</strong> There are almost 3 million people who subsist on the argan tree because it provides a lot of working days for the local population. The extraction of the<br >oil alone provides almost 1 million working days. But the most important role is the environmental role. The argan tree is really the last green curtain on the desert.</p><p><strong>Narrator:</strong> In just one generation, the international market for argan oil has risen from just 200 liters to 4,000 metric tons in 2019. By 2025, the state's ambition is to sell over 10,000 metric tons. To facilitate this increase, the area for producing the oil has expanded more than 100 miles south of Essaouira and is due to expand north.</p><p>As with any costly ingredient, argan oil products are often adulterated. Both cosmetic and culinary argan oil is often labeled as \"pure\" despite the undisclosed percentage of Argania kernel oil being mixed with a host of chemical compounds.</p><p>And cheaper, mechanically extracted oil has begun to appear on the market for as little as $22 a liter, threatening the stability of the local cooperatives. However, some cosmetic giants, such as L'Or&#233;al, have committed to fair-trade programs to help ensure the stability of their argan oil and the preservation of the forest's biodiversity.</p><p>With the help of the cooperatives, the traditional skills held by the Amazigh women have created a booming industry. But even though this income has granted some financial independence in a male-dominated society, the women normally make less than $220 a month - below Morocco's recommended national minimum wage.</p><p>With the argan oil industry predicted to continue its growth, the prosperity of the Amazigh women remains to be seen.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/why-argan-oil-is-so-expensive-morocco-goats-trees-beauty-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"Trump dismissed mixing sports with politics, saying protests in the NBA will ruin the sport","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-nba-players-boycotting-playoffs-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4bea4a7ffa48002894d0f6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"nba blm.JPG\" height=\"1111\" width=\"2222\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ashley Landis/Pool Photo via USA TODAY Sports</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>President Donald Trump told reporters last week that mixing politics with sports will \"destroy basketball.\"</li><li>Trump was asked on Friday about some initiatives from the NBA and its players to protest against police brutality, including delaying last week's playoff games days after Jacob Blake was shot by police.</li><li>\"You know when you watch sports, you want to sort of relax, but this is a whole different world ... You don't want to stay in politics. You want to relax,\" Trump said, before warning that political statements from football and baseball teams could be \"very bad\" for the leagues.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>President Donald Trump says politically inspired protests by NBA players will ruin the sport.</p><p>On Wednesday, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.in/sports/news/nba-games-have-been-postponed-and-the-season-is-in-jeopardy-as-players-meet-to-discuss-future-of-the-playoffs/amp_articleshow/77774397.cms\">NBA playoff games were postponed</a> as players from the <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/nba-games-postponed-not-canceled-season-in-jeopardy-2020-8\">Milwaukee Bucks, Houston Rockets, Oklahoma City Thunder, Los Angeles Lakers, and Portland Trail Blazers</a> chose not to play in response to the police shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha, Wisconsin.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Milwaukee Bucks  (@Bucks) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1298763794986995718?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 26, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>The <a href=\"https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29759939/nba-announces-playoffs-resume-saturday\">NBA announced that playoffs would resume on Saturday, August 29</a>, but the league will continue efforts to help shine a light on things like racial injustice, criminal just reform, police reform, and limited voting access.</p><p>When asked on Friday about actions the league and players in the wake of Jacob Blake's shooting by police, Trump said the political statements will \"destroy basketball.\"</p><p>\"It's terrible,\" Trump said, according to a White House press pool report. \"I think what they're doing to the NBA in particular is going to destroy basketball. I can't - I don't even watch it. ... You know when you watch sports, you want to sort of relax, but this is a whole different world. ... You don't want to stay in politics. You want to relax.\"</p><p>It's not just the NBA taking a stance. On Thursday, it was reported that several NFL teams sat out of practice in response to the shooting, which Trump also called \"very bad.\"</p><p>\"It's very bad for the NBA and it's going to prove to be very bad for football,\" Trump continued. \"It's going to be very bad for football and I think it's very bad for the NBA. Maybe even NBA threatening. And it's going to be very bad for baseball if they don't get smarter.\"</p><p>Among the football teams that canceled practice are the Chicago Bears, New York Jets, Green Bay Packers, Indianapolis Colts, Tennessee Titans, Denver Broncos, Arizona Cardinals, Los Angeles Chargers, and Washington Football Team, <a href=\"https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/29752219/some-nfl-teams-cancel-practices-response-jacob-blake-shooting\">according to ESPN</a>.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Indianapolis Colts  (@Colts) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1298971168708460546?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 27, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>As for the NBA, some teams have already announced that their arenas will be used for voting in November. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nba-arenas-to-become-2020-voting-sites-playoff-deal-2020-8\">Business Insider's Grace Panetta previously reported</a> that the league would \"establish a social justice coalition\" and broadcast ads during games that will promote voting in both national and local elections and spread awareness about the importance of improving voting access.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;LeBron James  (@KingJames) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1299852977545662464?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 29, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/1JvlUa4ches\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 30 Aug 2020 19:09:00 +0000","feedId":2931,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f4bdaeb60bf1f0028079657?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"76d56438e4439c5cd47b81ff64217eb9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn44@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-00-52-212_9f2230f1d0639ed0.webp","destWidth":2222,"destHeight":1666,"sourceBytes":189436,"destBytes":189436,"author":"insider@insider.com (Libertina Brandt)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f4bea4a7ffa48002894d0f6?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=1JvlUa4ches:9wpsnrsob5Y:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-00-188_91d07c1aa4505172.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-57-877_99a57cc2511f53cd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=bcOpcFrp8Mo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-56-954_403f715e664a4d00.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?i=1JvlUa4ches:9wpsnrsob5Y:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn69@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-00-56-390_922659a6a4dc0d4d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=cGdyc7Q-1BI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/31/06-01-02-412_be4dce30169e75ab.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=QXVau8BzmBE":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-01-03-283_c4d57f9dd1ff11a2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_1/2020/08/31/06-01-03-681_0165ab2292566722.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?d=7Q72WNTAKBA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/08/31/06-00-58-166_b28aa1f69f1eb446.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider/~4/1JvlUa4ches":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn16@2020_2/2020/08/31/06-00-59-636_74156c83adb99952.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650323},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-31 14:00:50","title":"A Wall Street chief strategist details 4 reasons why big-company profits have been remarkably resilient during the pandemic — and explains how that’s helped the red-hot stock rally","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-outlook-4-reasons-corporate-profits-resilient-coronavirus-recession-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f49480d7ffa48002894ce85?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Mask Wall Street\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Mark Lennihan</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500_500\">S&#38;P 500</a> corporate profits are holding up far better than they did in past recessions, and it helping fuel the stock market's summer rally, says James Paulsen, chief investment strategist at The Leuthold Group.</strong></li><li><strong>Shrinking GDP typically drives profit declines roughly four to five times larger than what was seen during the 2020 downturn.</strong></li><li><strong>Companies were able to limit earnings-per-share damage to \"one of the mildest recessionary contractions of the post-war era,\"&#160;Paulsen said. They did that despite the coronavirus fueling the biggest economic downturn in nearly a century</strong></li><li><strong>Outlined below are the four reasons why profits have held up so well during the coronavirus recession, according to the strategist.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestutm_source=msn.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=msn-slideshow&utm_campaign=bodyurl?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestts&#38;utm_medium=ingest\">Visit the Business Insider homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr ><p>Some of the stock market's extraordinary rally from March lows may have to do with how little corporate profits were pummeled by the coronavirus pandemic, says James Paulsen, chief investment strategist at The Leuthold Group.</p><p>Earnings weren't supposed to hold up as well as they did. The coronavirus pandemic prompted the largest quarterly and year-over-year gross domestic product declines in US history. Unemployment skyrocketed, consumer spending slowed immensely, and overall activity ground to a halt.</p><p>Plunges in US GDP have historically driven earnings-per-share declines four to five times larger than what was seen, the strategist found. This year's downturn reversed the trend. Though GDP has contracted nearly 11% from its recent high, EPS only dropped by 15%.</p><p>Companies were able to limit EPS damage to \"one of the mildest recessionary contractions of the post-war era\" despite the coronavirus fueling the biggest economic downturn in nearly a century, Paulsen said.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-hedge-mutual-funds-market-favorites-goldman-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">GOLDMAN SACHS: Buy these 9 stocks that are poised to continue crushing the market as the 'shared favorites' of Wall Street's biggest investors</a></em></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f4b9d1d60bf1f002807962d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020 08 30 at 8.35.21 AM\" height=\"841\" width=\"716\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"https://www.leutholdgroup.com/\" target=\"_blank\">The Leuthold Group</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>\"If firms are successful at minimizing the earnings impact of a record collapse in the economy, why shouldn't the stock market recover faster and more robustly?\" he wrote in a note to clients.</p><p>Detailed below are the four factors Paulsen says reinforced corporate earnings before and during the coronavirus recession.</p><h2>(1) Fed to the rescue</h2><p>To start, the government and Federal Reserve's response to coronavirus economic fallout was faster and larger than in any other recession. The Fed stepped in with unprecedented lending programs and asset purchase strategies, while Congress passed the historic $2.2 trillion CARES Act to inject fiscal relief into the economy.</p><p>The response was more than double the size of aid efforts used during the financial crisis, and seven times larger than those used after the dot-com bust, Paulsen said. The cocktail of fiscal and monetary relief \"buffered company sales trends\" from the damage typically incurred in a recession, he added.</p><p>Sales data for <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/index/s&p_500_500\">S&#38;P 500</a> companies shows just how directly the policy response buoyed earnings. For the first time in data going back to 1990, annual sales per share growth fell less than nominal GDP growth during a recession. The former even avoided contraction despite the dire backdrop.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-crash-david-rosenberg-dot-com-tech-bubble-distortions-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">35-year market vet David Rosenberg warns the stock market's rally features distortions that were glaring during the tech bubble &#8212; and lays out his plausible scenario for a crash</a></em></p><h2>(2) Companies battened down the hatches</h2><p>Just as the government responded to the virus's sudden shock, so did the nation's biggest corporations. Firms slashed costs by unprecedented amounts through layoffs and liquidations to maintain their cash piles. By the second quarter, the US output gap &#8212; a measure of how much firms under-utilize the economy's resources &#8212; sank to a post-war low.</p><p>Though the pandemic itself wasn't anticipated, companies were prepared themselves for the resulting economic hit, Paulsen said.</p><p>\"Because this recession was predictable, businesses moved more quickly and more assertively than ever in lowering breakeven points to preserve profits more effectively than in past cycles,\" the strategist added.</p><h2>(3) Shrunken household debt piles</h2><p>In past recessions, US households entered downturns with increasingly high levels of debt. Such indebtedness tends to worsen slumps, as Americans lack the extra cash to restart the country's economic engine.</p><p>This year has been different. The household debt burden sat near record lows when the recession started, leaving Americans with plenty more power to maintain spending and keep companies afloat. The personal savings rate heading into the recession was also double that seen before the 2000 and 2008 downturns. In all, these positive trends helped drive corporate sales and pad against a worse plunge than past recessions, the strategist said.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-cheap-companies-strong-earnings-morgan-stanley-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">MORGAN STANLEY: Buy these 12 underappreciated stocks that offer strong profit growth and are due for a surge</a></em></p><p>\"The US consumer came into this crisis in uncommonly strong financial shape, surrounded by a robust job market and with fewer headwinds than one normally faces when entering the recession,\" Paulsen said, adding the lack of hurdles could be \"why many consumer spending categories have bounced back quicker and stronger than most expected.\"</p><h2>(4) Bolstered rainy-day funds</h2><p>Companies also entered the coronavirus recession in better positions than usual. S&#38;P 500 firms' debt to earnings ratios stood at historic lows, and cash flow per dollar of sales was higher than in past downturns. Combined, the gauges reveal companies had less debt to worry about and healthier cash buffers once the pandemic stifled sales.</p><p>\"Having financial strength and flexibility, as opposed to the worsening vulnerabilities that often characterize the health of businesses in advance of a recession, provides far greater options when challenges emerge once in a recession,\" Paulsen wrote.</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-investing-strategy-wall-street-career-advice-savita-subramanian-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Savita Subramanian uses her philosophy major more than her math degree as Bank of America's US equity chief. She told us how it guides her investing strategy &#8212; and shared the drivers behind her career success.</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/us-tech-stocks-worth-more-european-stock-market-apple-microsoft-2020-8-1029545001\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">The US tech sector is now worth more than the entire European stock market, Bank of America says</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/credit-suisse-banker-fired-forged-weath-management-client-documents-loss-2020-8-1029544631\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Credit Suisse fired a banker who forged a wealth-management client's documents and cost the firm $11 million, a new report says</a></strong></em></p><div ider/~4/SxL4Up9EWNk":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598853650329},{"createdTime":"2020-08-31 life","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-calls-niece-who-wrote-book-unstable-rightfully-shunned-2020-8","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f058814f0f4190266355d04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"mary trump donald trump\" height=\"1000\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Trump&#39;s niece Mary Trump wrote a tell-all book about her uncle and their &#34;toxic&#34; family.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP/Getty</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>On Twitter Saturday, President Trump called his niece \"unstable\" and \"rightfully shunned, scorned, and mocked her entire life.\"&#160;</li><li>The berating came after his niece, Mary Trump, released new recordings of the president's sister criticizing his children.&#160;</li><li>Mary Trump's book, which came out in July, describes what she views as the president's history of bullying and cheating his way through life.&#160;</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>President Donald Trump blasted his niece, Mary Trump, on Twitter Saturday, calling her \"unstable\" and saying that she was \"rightfully shunned, scorned and mocked her entire life, and never even liked by her own very kind &#38; caring grandfather!\"&#160;</p><p>Mary, 55, is a clinical psychologist who wrote the scathing book \"<a href=\"https://www.google.com/search?q=Too+Much+and+Never+Enough&stick=H4sIAAAAAAAAAONgVuLVT9c3NEwrS4-3TCspeMRowS3w8sc9YSn9SWtOXmPU5OIKzsgvd80rySypFJLmYoOyBKX4uVB18ixilQzJz1fwLU3OUEjMS1HwSy1LLVJwzcsvTc8AAOPiD7FoAAAAAAAA\">Too Much and Never Enough: How My Family Created the World's Most Dangerous Man\"</a> about the president. It was released last month.&#160;&#160;</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Donald J. Trump  (@realDonaldTrump) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1299732423207301120?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">August 29, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Trump's tweets, in which he also said people can only land book deals and jobs with CNN and MSNBC (which he calls \"MSDNC\") if they \"contain as much bad 'stuff' as possible,\" came after Mary released <a href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/news/514242-mary-trump-reveals-recordings-of-trumps-sister-swiping-at-children-ivanka-and\">new recordings</a> of his sister, Maryanne Trump Barry, criticizing the president's children.&#160;</p><p>After Ivanka Trump posted <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/BjSXlG1lTuj/\">a photo of her and her son on Instagram</a> while the Trump administration was separating children from their families at the border, Barry can be heard in recordings saying: \"That damn Ivanka puts this picture of the Madonna and Child on Instagram when the big news of the day was how kids are being ripped from their families.\"&#160;</p><h2>Mary Trump's book describes accounts in which the president bullies and cheats \"as a way of life\"</h2><p>In her book, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mary-trump-book-excerpt-sats-clown-allowance-tax-documents-2020-7\">Mary describes how her uncle bullies and cheats \"as a way of life.\"</a> For example, she claims, he paid someone to take the SAT for him, which helped earn his admission to Wharton.</p><p>Mary also says the president went to the movies while his older brother was dying, and that his behavior is at odds with his evangelical base.</p><p>\"The only time Donald went to church was when the cameras were there,\" Mary writes, quoting her aunt. \"It's mind-boggling. But that's all about his base. He has no principles. None!\"</p><p>She blames Trump's nature on his abusive upbringing by a father who hated apologies more than failures, and who didn't allow the president to access or express his feelings.&#160;</p><p>\"That's what sociopaths do: they co-opt others and use them toward their own ends &#8212; ruthlessly and efficiently, with no tolerance for dissent or resistance,\" she writes.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-calls-niece-who-wrote-book-unstable-rightfully-shunned-2020-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?a=m57kfAiULUI:ATvKMXQBLKU:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/typepad/alleyinsider/silicon_alley_insider?a=m57kfAiULUI:ATvKMXQBLKU:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img
